Budgeting projects for IT infrastructure within the scope of the global digitalization strategy. Cooperation with the global IT security team to ensure continuous network security, data integrity, and compliance with industrial standards and regulations. Implementation and integration of Smart Factory devices at the machine level. Analyzing and solving technical challenges related to the integration of IoT and automation technologies. Your profile: Completed Bachelor's degree or equivalent qualification in Information Technology, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field. Experience in software development and application development. Programming skills in JavaScript, Python, or similar languages. Experience in IT or industrial IT roles with a focus on Smart Factory technologies, industrial automation, and digital transformation in manufacturing environments. Experience with Industry 4.0 technologies, including IoT, AI, machine learning, robotics, and data analysis platforms. Experience in implementing and integrating Smart Factory devices at the machine level. Familiarity with automation protocols (e.g., OPC UA, MQTT, Modbus) and industrial communication standards. job_title: On-Site Project Manager / Senior Site Manager (m/f/d) (Engineer - Mechanical Engineering)
full_description: Our mission is to plan, manufacture, deliver, assemble, and commission steam turbine units, with which we fully meet individual customer needs. We combine top quality with effective and safe processes and constantly question our thinking and actions regarding sustainability in relation to our products, the environment, and the health and development of our employees. As an employer, we are a professionally operating medium-sized company (with currently about 170 employees) that has retained the flexibility and responsiveness from the founding period through short decision-making processes and flat hierarchies. In this spirit, we think solution-oriented and pragmatically, are courageous and decisive, and can thus respond quickly and purposefully in the interest of customers and employees. To strengthen our international customer projects, we are looking for an on-site project manager / head of construction (m/f/d) immediately. How you fit with us: - You take responsibility for your actions towards our colleagues. - You enjoy working in a team because you like to be connected and think beyond your area. - Straightforward and direct communication is very important to you, but also respectful and appreciative. - You value it when a company expects not only loyalty from you but also advocates for its employees. - You are authentic and have integrity, live out your own values and beliefs, and bring along edges and corners. - You enjoy dealing with international customers, are willing to travel, and can express yourself well in German and English. Perhaps you speak another foreign language? What you are responsible for: In a service team consisting of project managers, site managers, and turbine installers, you are responsible for the qualified service of the complete steam turbine unit. This includes, among other things, the following tasks: - You are responsible for site management of assembly orders for turbine construction projects at our customers' locations. - You are the interface between customers, assembly, and commissioning team and project team at the headquarters. - You coordinate your own assembly and commissioning teams. - You schedule and technically supervise various trades such as piping, wiring, insulation, steel construction, etc. - You prepare the acceptance of construction and assembly services and coordinate the solution-oriented handling of any remaining issues. - You ensure compliance with safety standards and occupational health and safety regulations on the construction site. What we expect from you: - A successfully completed engineering degree (e.g. Mechanical Engineering or Process Engineering) or a successfully completed technical training (Industrial Mechanic, Maintenance Technician, Mechatronics Technician, etc.) - Relevant professional experience in machinery and plant engineering is required. - Willingness to travel. - Flexibility regarding working hours and location. - Result-oriented and independent working style. - Class B driving license. - Very good German language skills, good English language skills. - Good PC and IT skills. What we offer you: - Individual internal and external training measures. - 30 days of vacation/year. - Flexible working hours to reduce overtime. - Employee offers through Corporate Benefit Program. - Bicycle leasing as a monetary benefit. - Contributions to company pension schemes or VWL. - Employer-financed accident insurance (also for private accidents). You can apply directly via the application form on our homepage: https://www.tgmkanis.com/karriere ( https://www.tgmkanis.com/karriere ) TGM Kanis Turbinen GmbH Am Flachmoor 6 90475 Nürnberg Team Human Resources.

Job description: DESIRED KNOWLEDGE AND QUALITIES FOR THE JOB: communication skills, precision, conscientiousness and responsibility in work, willingness to work in a team, independence in performing work tasks EDUCATION: Completed secondary school lasting 4 years or more Bachelor's degree, professional studies and higher school IWE (International Welding Engineer), Doc. IAB-002-2000/EWF-409 IWT (International Welding Technologist); Doc. IAB-003-2000/EWF-410 IWS (International Welding Specialist); Doc. IAB-004-2000/EWF-411 WORK EXPERIENCE: Minimum 3 years in the profession as a welding coordinator Minimum 3 years of experience in knowledge of quality standards JOB DESCRIPTION: conducts final visual-measurement control of components and (or) products and testing of impermeability, fills out control-testing documentation, performs technological elaboration of work documentation (according to objectively available time), responsible for monitoring the process and application of welding (qualitative and quantitative) and control of applied standards along with possible supplementation of requirements, supervision of staff, including providing professional training and ensuring the correctness of welding equipment and qualifications of welders and operators including education, instructions, implementation and assessment, prepares production and complete accompanying documentation (WPS, WPQR…), welding plans and determining methods and range of validity methods for qualified welding procedures, testing the quality of welds by visual method, non-destructive testing (NDT), destructive and prepares reports for the same, takes care of preventive maintenance and correctness of welding equipment, prepares and conducts the A-certification of welders, communication with responsible customer staff related to welding, methods and application, performs welding of particularly demanding parts. WE OFFER: stimulating compensation in accordance with experience, knowledge and skills, possibility of permanent employment after probationary period, travel expenses, monetary rewards, meal allowance, occasion rewards (Christmas bonus, annual leave bonus, Easter bonus)

Based on Article 19, Paragraph 1 of the Law on Civil Servants and Employees in Local and Regional Self-Government ('Official Gazette' number 86/08., 61/11., 4/18., 112/19. and 17/25.), the heads of administrative bodies of the Osijek-Baranja County announce a PUBLIC COMPETITION for admission to service in administrative bodies of the Osijek-Baranja County. Admission to service is performed for an indefinite period except for the admission of trainees to positions under points 2.c) and 8.b) of this public competition. Admission to service is performed with a mandatory probationary period lasting three months except for admission of trainees to positions under points 2.c) and 8.b) of this public competition. Trainees are admitted to service for a fixed period of twelve months for the purpose of performing internship practice. General requirements for admission to service are: legal age, Croatian citizenship, health capability to perform the tasks of the job to which the person is admitted. Special conditions for admission to service for positions: 7. Administrative Department for Investments, Infrastructure and Development Projects for positions: b) Senior consultant for infrastructure projects - 1 performer (workplace: Osijek) university graduate study or university integrated undergraduate and graduate study or professional graduate study in civil engineering, electrical engineering or mechanical engineering, at least 4 years of work experience in relevant jobs, computer proficiency, passed state exam Level II. Both sexes may apply to the public competition. A person who has the necessary work experience in relevant jobs but does not have the passed state exam prescribed for the job to which they are assigned can be admitted to service and assigned to a position on the condition that they pass the state exam within one year from the start of work in the service determined by the decision on assignment to the position. Persons without work experience in the relevant level of education and profession, as well as persons with work experience shorter than the time prescribed for internship, can be admitted to service and assigned exclusively as trainees. A trainee may approach taking the state exam no earlier than three months before the expiry of the prescribed internship period and is obliged to take the exam no later than by the end of the internship period. Computer skills in the sense of this public competition are proven by a relevant public document, professional verification, diploma, certificate, employer's confirmation or statement. Professional verification in the sense of this competition also includes previous work in jobs for which the mentioned condition has been established. Professional exam in the sense of this public competition and job positions under points 2.a) and 2.b) refers to the professional exam for performing tasks of spatial planning or construction in accordance with special regulations. A person who has the necessary work experience in relevant jobs but does not have a passed professional exam can be admitted to service and assigned to a position on the condition that they pass the exam within one year from the date of meeting the conditions for taking the professional exam stipulated by special regulations in the field of spatial planning or construction. The training program for performing civil registry officer tasks in the sense of this public competition is attended at the State School for Public Administration according to the procedure and in the manner determined by special regulations. A person who has the necessary work experience in relevant jobs but has not completed the Training Program for performing civil registry officer tasks can be admitted to service and assigned to the position of civil registry officer and senior civil registry officer provided that they complete the mentioned Program within the time prescribed by special regulations. A person who is being prosecuted criminally on official duty or who has been convicted of a criminal offense for which criminal proceedings are conducted on official duty cannot be admitted to service unless it concerns a criminal offense related to road safety, provided that they have not been sentenced to an unconditional prison sentence for that criminal offense. A candidate for whom there are obstacles to admission as per Articles 15 and 16 of the Law on Civil Servants and Employees in Local and Regional Self-Government cannot be admitted to service. The application for the public competition must contain the applicant's data (name and surname, address, e-mail address and phone number), the name of the job position and administrative department to which the application refers, date of application and the handwritten signature of the applicant. Along with the application for the public competition, it is necessary to attach: a CV, proof of Croatian citizenship (a copy of a valid ID card, military ID or passport, or citizenship certificate), proof of the relevant level of education and profession (a copy of the certificate, diploma or other relevant public document), proof of work experience in relevant jobs, namely: a copy of the electronic record or confirmation of data recorded in the database of the Croatian Institute for Pension Insurance, which contains data about the employer, basis of insurance, beginning and cessation of insurance, working hours, level of acquired and required qualifications and duration of the insurance period and a copy of the employer's confirmation of the requested work experience, or a decision on assignment, or work contract or other relevant proof which must contain the type of work performed, necessary level of education and the period in which the jobs were performed only for positions under points 2.c) and 8.b), proof of lack of work experience in relevant jobs or having work experience shorter than the prescribed time for internship (12 months) namely: a copy of the electronic record or confirmation of data recorded in the database of the Croatian Institute for Pension Insurance, which contains data about the employer, basis of insurance, beginning and cessation of insurance, working hours, level of acquired and required qualifications and duration of the insurance period, a copy of the document proving the passed state exam if the candidate has passed the state exam, a copy of the document proving the passed professional exam for performing spatial planning or construction tasks in accordance with special regulations if the candidate has passed the professional exam (only for positions under points 2.a) and 2.b)), proof of passing the driver's exam for managing motor vehicles 'B' category (only for positions under points 2.a), 2.b) and 6.), a copy of the document on completed training or specialization for performing civil registry tasks at the State School for Public Administration if the candidate has completed the training or specialization program (only for the position under point 8.a)), proof of knowledge of computer work (relevant public document, professional verification, diploma, certificate, employer confirmation or statement). Candidates will be notified via the email address they provided in the application about the entitlement to participate in the preliminary verification of knowledge and abilities through written testing and interviews. Copies of documents do not need to be notarized. A candidate who, according to special regulations, has the right of preference in employment is obliged to refer to this right in the application for the public competition and has preference over other candidates only under equal conditions. To exercise the right of preference in employment, a candidate who meets the conditions for exercising that right is obliged to attach all evidence of meeting the requested conditions, as well as all required documentation according to special regulations to the application for the public competition. A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 101 of the Law on Croatian War Veterans and Members of Their Families ('Official Gazette' number 121/17., 98/19., 84/21. and 156/23.) is obliged to submit, in addition to the evidence of meeting the requested conditions, all necessary documents available at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans: https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843. A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 48.f of the Law on the Protection of Military and Civil War Invalids ('Official Gazette' number 33/92., 57/92., 77/92., 27/93., 58/93., 02/94., 76/94., 108/95., 108/96., 82/01., 103/03., 148/13. and 98/19.), in the application for the public competition, is obliged to, in addition to providing proof of meeting the requested conditions, refer to this right and enclose appropriate documents as proof of status, as well as other evidence according to the special law regulating that right. A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 47 of the Law on Civil Victims of the Homeland War ('Official Gazette' number 84/21.), in the application for the public competition is obliged, apart from proof of meeting the requested conditions, to submit a decision or confirmation of recognized rights. The link to the page of the Ministry of Veterans in which the evidence necessary to exercise the right of preference in employment according to the Law on Civil Victims of the Homeland War is stated is: https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843. A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities ('Official Gazette' number 157/13., 152/14., 39/18. and 32/20.) in the application for the public competition is obliged, in addition to proof of meeting the requested conditions, to submit proof of established status as a person with disabilities and proof of termination of employment with the last employer (contract, decision, ruling, etc.). A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 22 of the Constitutional Law on the Rights of National Minorities ('Official Gazette' number 155/02., 47/10., 80/10. and 93/11.) in the application for the public competition, in addition to the evidence of meeting the requested conditions, is not obliged to prove their status as a member of a national minority. A proper application is considered to be an application that contains all data and attachments specified in the public competition. Improper applications and applications submitted after the deadline for submitting applications for the public competition (late applications) will not be considered nor will applicants of incomplete applications be invited to supplement the application. Persons who submit late or incomplete applications for the public competition or do not meet the conditions of the public competition are not considered candidates registered for the public competition, about which a written notice will be sent to them. The process of the public competition includes mandatory verification of candidates' knowledge and abilities through written testing and interviews. On the website of the Osijek-Baranja County (www.obz.hr), a job description and data about the salary of the position being filled is available, as well as information about the preliminary verification of candidates' knowledge and abilities or the manner of conducting the preliminary knowledge and ability verification of candidates and from which area and legal and other sources for preparing candidates for the preliminary knowledge and ability verification and other information about the competition procedure. The time of holding the preliminary verification of candidates' knowledge and abilities will be published on the mentioned website and on the notice board of the Osijek-Baranja County in Osijek, Županijska 4, at least five days before the verification is held. Only candidates who meet the formal criteria from the public competition may participate in the preliminary knowledge and ability verification. According to Article 22, Paragraph 2 of the Law on Civil Servants and Employees in Local and Regional Self-Government, it is considered that a candidate who did not participate in the preliminary verification has withdrawn their application for the public competition. Applications for the public competition should be submitted to the address: Osijek-Baranja County, Administrative Department for Common Affairs, Osijek, Županijska 4, by mail or by personal delivery to the registry office within 8 days from the date of public announcement of the public competition in 'Official Gazette'. Applications are submitted in sealed envelopes marked 'for the competition' along with the name of the job position and administrative department to which the applicant is applying. A separate application in a separate envelope must be submitted for each job position. The selected candidate will be requested to submit, within an appropriate time, and before the decision on employment is made, a certificate from the competent court that no criminal proceedings are conducted against them and a certificate of health capability to perform the tasks of the job position as well as to present original documents proving compliance with the formal conditions from the public competition, with a warning that failing to submit the required documents is considered a withdrawal from employment. The costs of issuing a certificate of health capability shall be borne by the Osijek-Baranja County. Exceptionally, in the case of a candidate's withdrawal from employment, the candidate will bear the costs of issuing the certificate of health capability themselves. After the selection of candidates, and before the decision on the employment of the selected candidate is made, the administrative body of the Osijek-Baranja County responsible for civil servant relations will check ex officio if there is an obstacle for the admission to service due to the final conviction of the selected candidate for a criminal offense under Article 15 of the Law on Civil Servants and Employees in Local and Regional Self-Government and obstacles under Article 16 of the Law on Civil Servants and Employees in Local and Regional Self-Government. Candidates will be informed about the results of the public competition within the legal deadline by public announcement of the decision on the employment of the selected candidate on the website of the Osijek-Baranja County www.obz.hr. Delivery of the decision to all candidates is considered executed after the expiry of the eighth day from the date of public announcement of the decision on the website of the Osijek-Baranja County www.obz.hr. The process of the public competition will be suspended if no candidates apply within the time specified in the public competition or if the candidates do not meet the formal conditions for admission and assignment to the job position or candidates have not achieved satisfactory results in the conducted testing or interview or for which it has been determined in the psychological assessment that they do not have the abilities to perform the tasks of the job position. The process of the public competition may be suspended due to substantially changed circumstances that arise after issuing the public competition. A notice of suspension of the procedure, if it occurs, will be published on the website of the Osijek-Baranja County www.obz.hr. According to the provisions of the Law on the implementation of the General Data Protection Regulation ('Official Gazette' number 42/18.) and Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the documents submitted to the Public Competition are sent voluntarily by candidates applying for the Public Competition and it is considered that they have given consent for the processing of personal data. The data will be processed solely for the purpose of conducting the public competition. The terms used in this public competition for persons in the masculine gender are neutral and refer to both male and female persons.

job_title: ELECTRICAL ENGINEER, GRADUATED ELECTRICAL ENGINEER - TECHNICAL INSPECTOR
full_description: JOB DESCRIPTION: ELECTRICAL ENGINEER or GRADUATE ELECTRICAL ENGINEER WITH OR WITHOUT EXPERIENCE (possibility of hiring TRAINEES), 1 performer, full-time, employment for an indefinite period with a probation period of 6 months. The job involves technical testing and measurements as well as the preparation of appropriate reports on the results. Most of the work is performed in the field. Along with the application for the competition, candidates are required to submit: - CV, - proof of professional qualification (copy of diploma), - proof of work experience (confirmation or extract from the electronic record of data of the Croatian Institute for Pension Insurance / e-workbook) if available, - proof of passing the driving test for managing B category vehicles (due to fieldwork, an active driver is required). Applications with required documentation are to be sent to the e-mail address: inginspekt@inginspekt-opatija.hr. By applying to the competition, applicants explicitly express consent that Inginspekt-Opatija d.o.o. may collect and process data for the purpose of conducting the competitive process in accordance with legal regulations. Applicants may request at any time the cessation of further processing of personal data, or their deletion by sending a request to the e-mail address racunovodstvo@inginspekt-opatija.hr. Sending such a request by the applicant implies that they have withdrawn their application.

Job description: Preparation for performing work tasks agreed upon based on detection and reporting failures in energy installations In case of failure or breakdown, in collaboration with foremen and superiors, finds a way to resolve newly arising situations Ensures prioritization and deadlines when performing work Orders necessary material to perform the work or special tools needed for the repair of failures Keeps records of employee attendance at work Checks the correctness of incoming invoices Orders necessary contractors to ensure safe execution of work Updates and prepares necessary documentation of performed states Transfers professional knowledge and skills Supervises employees in their work activities Supervises compliance with occupational safety regulations and the use of personal protective equipment and tools Takes care of the correctness and safety of tools, equipment, and workplace. The employer requires: Naval Architecture, Electrical Engineering, Polytechnic.

Job description: - preparation of lighting technical calculations (Dialux) - preparation of technical documentation and cost estimates (Word, Excel; Powerpoint) - preparation of technical drawings (CAD) - professional communication with architects, electrical designers, interior designers, investors, and suppliers Advantage: - experience in preparing lighting technical calculations (Dialux, Relux) - experience in preparing technical drawings (CAD) - experience in selling professional lighting Required education: secondary school, higher vocational school, university degree in electrical engineering direction.

Job description: Preparing technology for the production process Monitoring and supervising trial series Optimizing technological processes in production Reviewing casting simulations Creating requests for design changes on pressure tools Creating technological instructions for casting machines and peripherals Training workers regarding the applied technology Analyzing scrap and complaints (8D) Interaction with customer representatives regarding the applied technology Responsibility for ensuring work is carried out in accordance with technological regulations and occupational safety regulations Candidates are expected to have: High school degree / university degree in mechanical engineering or related fields Active use of the English language Goal-oriented, results-driven, and efficient Decisiveness and ability for logical thinking Knowledge of computer work (MS Office, AutoCAD and desirable 3D programs) Category B driving license

Job description: The quality control technician is responsible for providing technical support to the quality assurance function in areas affecting production, as well as for supporting and leading corrective action activities. Key responsibilities: Carry out all activities related to the quality control department; Manage daily tasks according to the instructions of the immediate supervisor; Conduct inspections according to work orders; Collect and analyze data on defects; Monitor compliance with safety standards and regulations; Supervise other employees in the department; Report findings and results to management; Conduct audits and inspections; Collaborate closely with other departments such as engineering, procurement, and production; Provide training to new employees as necessary; Collaborate with internal teams to ensure compliance with quality standards; Respect all safety and health rules related to this position as well as supervisor instructions; Comply with all procedures within the company's safety policy. What we are looking for: Technical high school; Experience in similar jobs, preferably in the automotive industry; Knowledge of quality assurance processes and procedures; Ability to work independently; Strong organizational skills and attention to detail; Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written; Ability to effectively multitask while meeting deadlines; Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); Strong knowledge of the English language is essential; Ability to work in a team environment; Excellent initiative and decision-making ability; Willingness to work in shifts. What we offer: Holiday bonuses; Discounts on sports activities; Employee wellness programs; Additional health insurance; Meal and transportation allowances; Benefits for professional certificates. Shift work compensation If you are interested, please apply online with a resume in English.

Job description: Managing industrial robots Correcting lubrication programs for pressure tools Preparing lubrication operations and coating mixing systems Repairing and maintaining coating heads for pressure tools according to instructions and technology requirements Knowledge, understanding, and checking fundamental parameters of coating pressure tools and automated processes Candidates are expected to have: Technical high school (mechatronics, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering) Category B driving license Ability to work in three shifts

Job description / Key responsibilities: Handling and supervising production equipment, tools, and machines (at least two production lines). Adjusting production lines for different products (when tool use is not required). Inspecting raw materials before use and finished products before shipping. Adjusting machines to maintain optimal productivity and quality. Working according to daily plans and work orders. Maintaining cleanliness and hygiene of the workplace according to safety standards. Resolving minor faults and reporting major ones to the technician / senior operator / shift leader. Collaborating with the team to ensure smooth production flow. Using personal protective equipment and applying safety rules. Basic maintenance of equipment: cleaning, lubrication, and visual inspections. Participating in training new operators and in starting/testing equipment. Attending team meetings and providing suggestions for process improvements. Monitoring inventory of raw materials and finished products and informing superiors about consumption. Quality control of products throughout the process. Packing and labeling products according to specifications. Operating manual and electric forklifts (if necessary). Participating in format changeovers between production cycles. Applying all standard operating procedures (SOP). Timely communication with superiors regarding production and any issues. Participating in safety drills and emergency procedures. Supporting the introduction of new technologies and processes. Identifying and reporting potential quality or safety issues Qualifications: Secondary vocational education (preference: food, technical or related field). At least 2 years of experience in food production or a similar industry. Ability to operate production equipment and monitor the production process. Basic knowledge of computer work (data entry, operation of equipment). Reading and executing written work orders. Knowledge of basic safety protocols and quality standards. Ability to identify minor faults and perform basic repairs or timely report to maintenance. Attention to detail. Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic production environment. Team spirit and basic communication skills. Reliability, accuracy, and good work discipline. Ability to quickly adapt to new requirements and processes. Basic knowledge of inventory management and ergonomics and sustainability in production. Willingness to learn new technologies and processes.

We are looking for a motivated person to support production and ensure the smooth operation of equipment and processes on production lines. Your tasks: Maintenance and optimization of machines and programs. Monitoring line operations and ensuring maximum efficiency. Preventive and corrective maintenance of equipment. Cooperating with operators and engineers and providing support and training. Participating in process and product quality improvements. Adhering to safety rules and procedures. What we are looking for: Technical high school education. Basic technical knowledge (software and hardware). Good computer skills. Problem-solving ability and capability to work independently. Knowledge of the English language. Willingness to work shifts. What we offer: Work in a modern and safe environment. Holiday bonuses. Discounts on sports activities. Additional health insurance. Employee wellness programs. Meal and transportation allowances. Opportunities for professional certification and career development. Shift work supplements Join our team and be part of innovations! Apply online with a resume in English.

As a technician for testing in production, you will support the development and implementation of testing solutions for electronic products. You will closely collaborate with testing engineers, production, and testing support teams to ensure a smooth production process, high testing quality, and continuous improvement. Your responsibilities include assisting testing engineers in the development and qualification of test devices and programs. Assembling and creating testers, devices, and tools according to customer needs. Creating clear documentation and conducting training for all testing solutions for testing support and production teams. Monitoring and improving testing performance indicators such as yield, efficiency, and availability. Coordinating readiness for testing in accordance with production schedules and priorities. Supporting continuous improvement initiatives aimed at optimizing testing coverage and reducing costs. Ensuring that all testing operations are documented and that staff is properly trained. Collaborating with various departments for timely and effective support. Performing other related tasks as needed. Key technical skills you will use include assembling testing devices - creation and maintenance of testing setups and tools. Documentation and training - creating clear guides and training materials for testing processes. Optimization of testing processes - improving testing coverage, cost-effectiveness, and reliability. Data collection and analysis - monitoring testing yield, availability, and occasional failures. Working on computers and software knowledge - using Windows-based systems and internal software tools. Basic math and chart interpretation - calculating rates, ratios, and interpreting visual data. Problem-solving - identifying problems and proposing practical solutions. Communication skills - clearly explaining technical concepts to different teams. What are we looking for? A good understanding of electronics and testing processes. Confident use of computers and software tools. Good communication and documentation skills. Knowledge of the English language. Basic math knowledge and analytical thinking. Experience in a production or testing environment is an advantage. Willingness to work in shifts. What do we offer? A high-standard work environment. Holiday bonuses. Discounts for sports activities. Additional health insurance. Employee wellness programs. Meal and transportation allowances. Support for professional certifications. Opportunities to participate in global projects. Shift work allowances.

job_title: OPERATOR (MALE/FEMALE) FOR MAINTENANCE OF PRODUCTION LINES
full_description: Job description: performing jobs and tasks of high complexity in the maintenance of machines and equipment for work; working on the maintenance of the production line; working on the maintenance of the factory and supporting equipment; working on the maintenance of the factory's infrastructure systems; conducting training for operators related to job maintenance; monitoring and recording errors and problems on machines; maintaining hygiene and cleanliness of the workplace; maintaining the factory environment as needed; performing tasks at heights greater than 3 m as needed; operating and managing self-propelled mechanical machines as needed. Minimum vocational secondary education in a technical field (electrical technician, mechatronics, automation in industry), experience in machine and production line maintenance is an advantage.

Job description: designing hydro installations. Working in 2D and 3D CAD programs. Conditions: completed type of education - technical direction. Previous experience is not a requirement but is desirable. Desirable knowledge of working in CAD programs. The employer offers work in a well-established team and a positive work atmosphere.

Main project manager: Collaboration with project managers, and supervision and verification of their work. Development of project preparation phases: drafts, cost planning, procurement. Collaboration with the designer, creating order details. Executing and documenting construction as per the contract - creating, implementing, and monitoring organizational, scheduling, and financial plans of the construction site. Agreeing on production requirements. Setting project priorities. Agreeing on changes that arise during project execution. Other knowledge and skills: Developed organizational skills. Precision and analytical thinking. Commitment. Teamwork. We offer you: Stimulating income. Compensation for warm meals, Christmas bonuses, Easter bonuses, child gifts. Skill and knowledge development. Exceptionally dynamic job in a stimulating team environment.

Job description: Regular, extraordinary, and technical maintenance of prominent shopping centers in Zagreb. Daily inspections of the center. Equipment control. Onboarding with a mentor. Required education, knowledge, and skills: Vocational/secondary education in electrical, mechanical, or similar technical fields. Preferably 1 year of work experience in the profession. Independence and initiative in performing tasks. Responsibility and organization. Willingness to work in shifts (including night shifts). Place of work: Zagreb. The employer offers: Work in a dynamic and challenging environment. Opportunity for advancement in the company structure based on work and dedication. Stimulating and organized income (overtime hours, allowances, bonuses). Compensation for transportation based on residence. Opportunities for further education (internal and external training).

Commercial - technical jobs in Croatia and Germany. Higher education (VSS/VŠS/SSS) in technical or construction direction. Knowledge of work organization in assembly. Knowledge of MS Office package. Knowledge of working in 2D/3D CAD software for design (Solidworks preferred). Knowledge of the German language is an advantage. Requirement: technical profession (SSS/VŠS/VSS). Responsibility, precision. Candidates with work experience have an advantage.

Job description: Performing control and monitoring of cut sheet metal positions and finished products. Requirement: completed secondary school (SSS/VŠS/VSS) in the metal field. Computer literacy (MS Office) is necessary. Desired: 2 years of work experience in the metal industry in similar positions. Reliability, technical understanding, and willingness to work are expected from candidates.

Job description: A metal processing factory with many years of experience in the production of fireplace stoves and related products is looking for a mechanical engineer with previous work experience. Job description: participation in product development and improvement, technical preparation for production, creation of technical documentation, collaboration with production and sales teams. Requirements: VSS – graduate engineer of mechanical engineering or mag. ing. mech., several years of work experience in similar jobs is preferred, good knowledge of technical drawings and working in CAD tools, responsibility, precision, and a tendency to teamwork. We offer: permanent employment, opportunities for professional development, a pleasant and dynamic working environment.

Job description: Development and standardization of technological processes in all phases of production, creating workshop documentation for production, creating operational norms, participating in the creation of technical product descriptions, participating in the implementation and development of new products, preparing calculations and components in collaboration with the team, controlling components for product materials, improving existing product devices using new materials and technologies to increase productivity and simplify series production, monitoring the first series of products and actively participating in the creation of work instructions, coordinating and directing technologists across all plants and business units, introducing new technological solutions, machines, and tools. Requirements: professional qualification: VŠS/VSS in technical field, knowledge of CAD, CAM programs (Solidworks), preferred work experience in similar positions minimum of 3 years, preferred experience in programming CNC milling machines (3 and 5 axes) with CAD CAM system SolidWorks/SolidCAM, creating and understanding workshop drawings, 3D models, components, and other technical documentation, active knowledge of English in speech and writing, active use of MS Office package. Desired knowledge and skills: problem-solving ability, excellent spatial orientation, outstanding organizational skills, initiative, proactivity, authority, responsibility, developed strong work ethic, and a positive attitude towards work and the team you will cooperate with. Your satisfaction is important to us, so we offer: paid transportation and allowance for warm meals, bonuses and annual rewards, external and internal training and education, additional paid leave days (e.g., birth of a child, relocation…), employee insurance against accident consequences, MultiSport program, opportunity for professional development and advancement, working in a stable and promising company on dynamic work tasks and challenging projects, working in a young and dynamic team in a friendly atmosphere, bonuses and rewards for innovations, suggestions for improving the production process.

Job description: *LEADING PRODUCTION OF METAL STRUCTURES *RECEIVING DRAWINGS FROM THE OFFICE *KNOWLEDGE AND READING OF TECHNICAL DOCUMENTATION *DISTRIBUTION OF WORK IN THE WORKSHOP *COMMUNICATION BETWEEN OFFICE AND WORKSHOP *CONTROL AND REVIEW OF PRODUCED ELEMENTS *RESPONSIBILITY

Job description: Working in the technical office on the design, analysis, and optimization of mechanical structures. Responsibilities: - designing and analyzing mechanical structures using CAD and CAE tools - preparing technical documentation and load calculations - optimizing designs in accordance with functional and safety requirements - collaborating with production and other engineering teams - keeping up with the latest technologies and standards in the field of mechanical engineering. Requirements: - completed university undergraduate and graduate studies or a university integrated undergraduate and graduate degree in the field of mechanical engineering, mechanics, or related technical sciences or secondary vocational education with several years of experience in the field of mechanical metal constructions, building constructions, mechatronics, robotics, automation, or related areas - experience in designing mechanical structures - advanced computer usage and working in CAD/CAE programs (SolidWorks, AutoCAD, Inventor, Ansys...), excellent navigation in virtual work environments, understanding of modular relational modeling concepts and methodical construction - experience in creating workshop, assembly, and installation drawings, knowledge of basic metal processing technologies (cutting, bending, welding…), understanding the principles of application and importance of tolerances in the design of complex assemblies, theoretical knowledge and ability to apply it to the preparation of calculations of mechanical properties of structures, understanding the principles of computer simulations of material stress using numerical analysis principles - experience in industrial projects and serial production - knowledge of standards and regulations in the field of mechanical engineering - excellent knowledge of English language in speech and writing - experience participating in research and development projects is an advantage - candidates with a degree in the field of mechanical engineering - direction Design and Mechanical Analysis or direction Mechatronics and Robotics are preferred. Application for the competition: Applicants are required to submit: a resume, a copy of citizenship and birth certificate, a copy of diploma of the relevant academic degree, evidence of meeting the required conditions (proof of experience, proof of language proficiency, proof of computer skills), proof of knowledge of the Croatian language (min. level B2 - for foreign nationals) and a certificate of non-conviction. A complete application is considered one that contains all the information and attachments as specified in the competition. Applicants who submit incomplete or untimely applications and those who do not meet the formal requirements of the competition will not be considered applicants for the competition. By submitting the application for the competition, the applicants expressly agree and give consent to MLC electronic d.o.o. for the collection and processing of personal data mentioned in the application and documentation submitted with the application for the purpose of conducting the competition process in accordance with the provisions of the General Regulation on Data Protection. Applications with the requested documentation (originals or copies) should be submitted/sent to the address: MLC electronic d.o.o., Ivana Gorana Kovačića 2, 10451 Pisarovina, marked: 'For the competition' or by email to liljana.posavec-babic@mlc.hr. Copies of the requested documents should be attached to the application, while originals are to be submitted later upon request from MLC electronic d.o.o.

job_title: INSTALLER (MALE/FEMALE) OF PVC AND ALUMINUM JOINERY
full_description: Job description: Installing PVC and ALU joinery. Employer requires: Minimum of two years of work experience in the installation of PVC and ALU doors and windows.

Job description: Independent locksmith/installer for the production of fences, and their installation. The candidate must be independent, skilled with tools, and ready for teamwork. Saturdays and Sundays are non-working. Expected salary from 1300-2000 €, depending on skills and progress. Possibility of permanent employment.

Job description: Sets up and installs profiles, panels and insulation for the construction of partition walls, suspended ceilings, and wall cladding. The job includes measuring, cutting, and precisely placing materials, as well as performing work on new or adapted buildings.

Job description: preparatory work and area protection, installation of GK (drywall) partition walls, installation of GK cladding and ceilings, plastering, sanding, patching and closing holes or damages. Condition: qualified drywall installer who can perform their job independently. Fieldwork across the entire area of Croatia.

INSTALLATION OF VENTILATED FACADES AND CONSTRUCTION SHEET METAL WORK IN CROATIA AND SLOVENIA - independent use of appropriate measuring, electrical, and hand tools - installation of substructures - installation of ventilated facades, sheet metal elements - knowledge of reading technical plans is an advantage, but not a requirement

Job description: installs drywall (Knauf, Rigips, etc.) on walls and ceilings, creates partition walls, wall and ceiling coverings, suspended ceilings, installs thermal and sound insulation, mounts metal substructures (profiles) to which panels are attached, processes joints, edges, and final layers (filling, smoothing, sanding)

job_title: LEADING INSTALLER (MALE)/LEADING INSTALLER (FEMALE) FOR ALUMINUM SYSTEMS
full_description: Job description: Installation and embedding of ALU joinery. Leading a team in the field and organizing tasks. Knowledge of all aluminum systems including knowledge of ALU continuous and structural facades. Basic knowledge of ventilated facades.

job_title: 10. IT ADVISOR – WEB DEVELOPER IN THE IT SERVICES DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT – INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY DIVISION
full_description: 10. IT ADVISOR – WEB PROGRAMMER IN THE IT SERVICES DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT – INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY DEPARTMENT • one executor for an indefinite period, with a probationary period of six months. Requirements: completed university master's degree or university integrated undergraduate and master's degree or professional master's degree, i.e. higher education, in the field of technical sciences, field of computer science, or field of electrical engineering, or area of social sciences, field of information science or information and communication sciences, 4 years of work experience in relevant jobs, knowledge of the English language. According to Article 13 of the Gender Equality Act, persons of both sexes have the right to apply under equal conditions. Candidates are required to attach: • CV • proof of citizenship • proof of the required qualifications (copy of diploma or certificate and additional documents, depending on which position the application is for) • proof of work experience (electronic record of data recorded in the central registry of the Croatian Pension Insurance Institute - e-workbook or employer's certificate about the jobs performed or a work contract showing work experience in the required jobs) • proof of acquired professional or higher professional title (for jobs where this is a requirement) • certificate that no criminal proceedings are pending, not older than six months • proof of knowledge of the required foreign language if it is a requirement for the workplace (copy of school certificate or index or certificate from a language school or proof of work/residence abroad) In the application for the competition, it is mandatory to include an email address. Documents are attached in unverified copies, and before the candidate is selected, the candidate proposed for the establishment of an employment relationship will present the originals. The deadline for submitting applications is 10 (ten) days from the date of publication on the Croatian Employment Service. By submitting an application for the public competition, the candidate agrees to the method of collecting and processing their personal data. Applications for the competition with attachments should be sent by mail to: National and University Library in Zagreb, Ulica Hrvatske bratske zajednice 4, 10000 Zagreb, marked 'Application for filling vacant positions (mention serial number and job title) from 8.12.2025.' A proper application is considered one that contains all data and attachments specified in the public competition. Incomplete and late applications will not be considered. Candidates who can exercise the right of preference in public service employment, in accordance with Article 102 of the Act on Croatian War Veterans and their Families (Official Gazette No. 121/17, 98/19, 84/21, 156/23), Article 48.f of the Act on the Protection of Military and Civilian War Invalids (Official Gazette No. 33/92, 77/92, 27/93, 58/93, 2/94, 76/94, 108/95, 108/96, 82/01, 103/03, 148/13, 98/19), and Article 9 of the Act on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities (Official Gazette No. 157/13 - consolidated text, 152/14, 39/18, 32/20) must refer to this employment preference right in their application concerning other candidates, only under equal conditions. Candidates invoking the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 102 of the Act on Croatian War Veterans and their Families must, along with their application for the competition, submit evidence prescribed by Article 103, paragraph 1 of the Act on Croatian War Veterans and their Families. Link to the list of evidence for exercising the right of preference in employment: https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843. Candidates invoking the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 9 of the Act on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities must, together with their application for the public competition, submit evidence of fulfilling the required conditions and proof of established disability status. Testing may be conducted, about which candidates will be notified in a timely manner. All candidates will be notified of the results of the competition in the same way and within the same timeframe. The submitted competition documentation will not be returned. Job descriptions and tasks of advertised positions are specified in the Regulation on the Internal Organization of the NSK published on the Library's website under the category Regulations and Business Procedures.

We are looking for a person for a project developing new software for monitoring and statistics related to automatic clubs and migration to an online gaming system, fault detection, repair, and other electronic jobs. Other knowledge and skills: - resourcefulness - teamwork - good knowledge of computer work - fault detection - repair of electrical devices

Development of web applications for the hospitality sector with a focus on catering and deliveries. Job description: • Leads the development of web applications. • Sets up the technical architecture, oversees code quality. • Participates in product planning, development of new functionalities. • Responsible for application stability, performance, security, and integrations. • Creation and improvement of application design along with the necessary graphic design. Requirements: • Education in an appropriate technical field (computer science, informatics, electrical engineering, or related) in progress or completed is preferred. • Minimum 2 years of experience in web page and application development, with proven results. • Strong ability to independently solve technical problems. • Knowledge of the following technologies: HTML, CSS, Tailwind, Javascript, Typescript, React, and related tools. • Knowledge of using relational databases and SQL queries. We offer: • Work on an ambitious project. • Independence in making technical decisions and shaping the platform. • Flexible working model with the possibility of working from home.

Development of web applications for the hospitality sector with a focus on catering and deliveries. Job description: • Carries out testing of existing and new functionalities. • Finds and describes bugs in detail. • Collaborates with development engineers during functionality implementation. • Participates in product planning, development of new functionalities, providing suggestions for improving user experience. • Maintains the quality of application delivery to clients. • Supports clients in using the application. Requirements: • Knowledge of the hospitality sector, problems, and the current state of the market for available application solutions. • Good computer and internet skills. • Use of existing application tools in the hospitality sector (POS terminals, Glovo, Bolt, Wolt). • Knowledge of tools like JIRA is desirable. We offer: • Work on an ambitious project. • Independence in decision-making and shaping the platform. • Flexible working model with the possibility of working from home.

job_title: JAVA DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER / JAVA DEVELOPER M/F
full_description: We are looking for a Java developer (m/f) to strengthen our team in Varaždin. Job description: • Development and maintenance of high-quality software solutions and complex web applications in a Java environment. • Translating business requirements into design and implementation of software features and functionalities. • Participation in the design and development of software architecture. • Participation in international projects. • Studying and introducing new technologies into everyday work. • Work location: Varaždin. Requirements: • Successfully completed IT studies (undergraduate/graduate) or comparable education. • Strong sense of responsibility and analytical and conceptual thinking. • Good knowledge of English language in speech and writing. • Ability to work in a team and developed communication skills. Preferences (not mandatory): • Experience working with Java frameworks, ideally Spring / Spring Boot. • Knowledge of working with relational databases and SQL. • Experience in developing and integrating REST APIs. • Knowledge of version control tools (e.g., Git). • Experience working in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban). What we offer: • Work on interesting and long-term projects in collaboration with international partners. • Opportunity for professional development and continuous education. • Hybrid work model, depending on agreement and project needs. • Official laptop and all necessary equipment for work. • Support from an experienced team and open knowledge exchange. • A stable work environment and a pleasant, informal work atmosphere. • Competitive salary in line with the candidate's knowledge and experience. • Possibility of bonuses, depending on results and involvement.

Long-term collaboration per project (possibility of ongoing monthly engagements). Workplace: Remote work.

Flexible working hours Work from home Work on interesting and diverse projects Opportunities for advancement and learning new technologies Pleasant and relaxed working atmosphere If you love front-end but want to stay close to backend, and are looking for a stable and flexible environment — contact us! Applications and portfolio, references if you have them, send to email.

job_title: PRODUCTION MANAGER IN THE WOOD INDUSTRY
full_description: The Požgaj Group is a modern, innovative, and efficient international company primarily engaged in the production of parquet and semi-finished products for the furniture industry, which aims to develop a recognizable and respected brand representing synonym for quality and effective solutions for companies, institutions, and private clients. The Požgaj Group creates added value through the development of new innovative products, identifying new business opportunities, setting market trends, and recognizing and developing human potential. For further expansion, Požgaj Group seeks responsible employees for the position: PRODUCTION MANAGER IN THE WOOD INDUSTRY As a "PRODUCTION MANAGER IN THE WOOD INDUSTRY," you will be responsible for the following tasks: organizing production/drying chamber operations - monitoring and meeting deadlines and capacities, leading and controlling the wood drying and steaming process and wood chemical protection process, introducing modern methods and technologies in production with a vision for further possibilities and increases in production, determining deadlines for product deliveries, developing normative and methodological documentation according to technical specifications, establishing work standards, material standards, and performing calculations per product and work phases, preparing, creating, and processing technical documentation related to drying chamber operations for production needs, developing pilot programs for possible production process improvements, as well as direct participation in their implementation, making recommendations/decisions regarding the need for new technology introduction in production, monitoring the correct interpretation and compliance with safety regulations by other employees in the workplace, developing proposals to increase and improve production and drying processes in drying chambers, analyzing/reporting and developing programs and procedures related to drying chamber operations. DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS Conditions: at least 6th level vocational education in the wood direction or other relevant technical orientation, work experience in the same/similar role, excellent knowledge of wood technology, desire for new knowledge. The employer pays for a hot meal.

Job/Job description: preparing models within and outside of the CNC machine so that when the programmer finishes the program, the models are ready for processing, maintaining the machine by cleaning sawdust from the inside of the machine, cleaning and maintaining the surrounding area of the machine, and preparing the machine for operation in the next shift. Special benefits: possibility of permanent employment, rewards and incentive system, opportunity for continuous improvement and development, stimulating and pleasant working atmosphere, ensured hot meal. SALARY – depending on commitment and results of individual work and the entire team, monthly earnings range from 1200€ to 1500€. Working hours: full-time (8 hours) – three shifts: 06:00 – 14:00, 14:00 – 22:00, 22:00 – 06:00. Application method: email: pib-extra@pib-extra.hr SEND: application, CV, proof of completed education. If there are no candidates or workers who meet the prescribed conditions concerning professional or educational qualifications for specific jobs, an employment contract may also be concluded with a candidate who does not meet the established conditions but has been determined by the employer to possess the necessary knowledge and experience sufficient to perform the jobs for which the job advertisement was posted. In this case, the specified special conditions will not apply to the respective worker.
