company_name: UNIVERSITY OF ZAGREB ACADEMY OF FINE ARTS
full_description: GENERAL CONDITIONS: - VSS - Qualification obtained by completing specialist graduate professional studies or graduate university studies, and integrated undergraduate and graduate university studies (HKO level 7.1. st. or 7.1. sv.) in a relevant field - at least four (4) years of work experience, with at least one (1) year of experience in the implementation and maintenance of IT systems - possession of a valid driver's license (B category) REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS: - experience in systematic maintenance of Windows and Linux servers - good knowledge of network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP) - experience in systematic maintenance of services (DNS, mail, web, LDAP, Radius, MYSQL databases) - excellent knowledge of working in a Windows environment - propensity for teamwork - good written and verbal communication in Croatian and English. Candidates holding any industrial certifications (Cisco CCNA, etc.) may have an advantage. JOB DESCRIPTION: - implementing, administering, and maintaining infrastructural server solutions (virtualization, backup, disaster recovery, storage, cloud, etc.) - ensuring the security of user data and proper data backup creation - implementing improvements in information systems in accordance with business requirements to provide adequate IT support for conducting business processes within the Academy - providing expert and operational support in all segments of information and communication business - performing the duties of a system engineer and network administrator during installation, configuration, and maintenance of server operating systems and services as well as active network equipment - managing, administering, monitoring, and maintaining databases of central infrastructural services (directories - LDAP and user (domain) accounts, mailing lists, as well as various servers - Windows and Linux server operating systems (AD, DHCP, TCP/IP, DNS)) - performing the duties of a CARNET system engineer at all locations of the Academy and, in case of incident situations, coordinating actions in accordance with the CARNET regulations - informing employees about security rules, system access, and risk management, about news and changes from their scope of work - planning and monitoring the security of information infrastructure - participating in the introduction of software solutions and business systems and caring for their maintenance and improvement - assigning and revoking rights and powers to users within the Academy's information system REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION FOR CANDIDATES: 1. application for the competition 2. CV (in any format) 3. proof of citizenship (copy of ID card, passport, or citizenship certificate) 4. proof of the appropriate level of education (copy of diploma) 5. other documentation confirming qualifications and experience (certificates, etc.) 6. proof of work experience - electronic record of employment status (e-workbook) 7. proof of possession of a valid driver's license (B category - copy of driver's license) 8. proof of knowledge of the English language (minimum B2 - copy of index, transcript of grades, certificates, etc.) 9. candidates who are not Croatian citizens should provide proof of knowledge of the Croatian language (minimum C1) APPLICATION FOR THE COMPETITION In the application for the competition, the candidate's personal data must be stated (name and surname, date and place of birth, residential address, phone number, or mobile phone) and the name of the position for which the person is applying. A complete application is considered to be one that contains all the data and appendices stated in the public competition. A person who has not submitted a timely and/or complete application, or does not meet the formal conditions from the public competition, or has not submitted an application at all, will not be considered a candidate. In accordance with Article 13 of the Gender Equality Act ("Official Gazette" no. 82/08 and 69/17), both genders may apply for the competition, and terms in masculine form used in the competition are used neutrally and refer to both males and females. Candidates who submit their application by personal delivery should include copies of their documents without official certification. The selected candidate must submit documentation proving the fulfillment of the required conditions in the original or certified copy before the employment contract is concluded. Late and incomplete applications will not be considered.

job_title: SENIOR ADVISOR FOR ISSUANCE OF BUILDING PERMITS
full_description: The Head of the Department for the Communal System and Spatial Planning and the Head of the Department for Finance and Budget, based on Article 19 of the Law on Civil Servants and Employees in Local and Regional Self-Government ("Official Gazette", no. 86/08, 61/11, 4/18, 112/19 and 17/25 – hereinafter referred to as: LSN), announce a PUBLIC COMPETITION for employment in the City of Umag - Umago, for the following positions: Department for Communal System and Spatial Planning Senior Advisor for Issuing Building Acts (1 executor - m/f), for an indefinite period, with a mandatory probationary period of three months. Specific conditions for employment: university graduate study (or integrated undergraduate and graduate study) or specialist graduate study in architecture, civil engineering, or law; at least four years of work experience in related jobs; passing the state exam of II level. The specific conditions for employment for all the above-mentioned positions also include knowledge of the Italian language and computer skills. Candidates must also meet the general conditions for employment as prescribed in Article 12 of the LSN (legal age, Croatian citizenship, and medical fitness to perform the tasks of the job being applied for). For the employment of a foreign national or stateless person, in addition to meeting the conditions prescribed by specific law, prior approval from the state administration body responsible for civil service relations is needed. For documentation in a foreign language, a certified translation must be submitted. Work experience in related jobs refers to experience (service in administrative bodies of local or regional self-governments, state service, public service, employment with private employers, independent performance of professional activities according to special regulations, or performing jobs in international organizations) achieved at a level of appropriate educational qualification and field, according to Article 13 of the LSN. Candidates who do not have the required level of state exam may also compete, with the obligation to pass it within one year of the start of service, if they succeed in the probationary period. Candidates who do not have certificates or attests proving knowledge of Italian at level A1, but meet other competition conditions, can be admitted to service and assigned to the position on the condition that they acquire the required certificate or attestation within the time frame defined by the Regulation on Internal Order of the City Administration "Official Gazette of the City of Umag – Umago", no. 9/23, 13/23, 22/23, 5/24, 7/24, 11/24, 16/24, 17/24, 1/25 and 7/25 – hereinafter: Regulation). Candidates who do not possess certificates, attestations, or other confirmations on computer skills but meet other competition conditions can also be hired and assigned to the position, provided they obtain the required certificate or attestation within the timeframe defined by the Regulation. Individuals cannot be hired if there are obstacles to their employment as specified in Articles 15 and 16 of the LSN. Candidates with the right to preference in hiring according to special regulations must refer to this right in their application and attach the necessary documentation according to the specific law regulating this right; they are prioritized over other candidates only under equal conditions. A candidate referencing the right to preference in employment in accordance with Article 101 of the Law on Croatian Defenders of the Homeland War and Members of Their Families ("Official Gazette", no. 121/17, 98/19, 84/21 and 156/23), Article 47 of the Law on Civil Victims of the Homeland War ("Official Gazette", no. 84/21), Article 48.f of the Law on the Protection of Military and Civil Invalids of War ("Official Gazette", no. 33/92, 57/92, 77/92, 27/93, 58/93, 2/94, 76/94, 108/95, 108/96, 82/01, 103/03, 148/13 and 98/19), Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities ("Official Gazette", no. 157/13 – consolidated text, 152/14 and 39/18) and Article 22 of the Constitutional Law on the Rights of National Minorities ("Official Gazette", no. 155/02, 47/10, 80/10 and 93/11) must refer to this right in their application; they have preference over other candidates under equal conditions. When invoking the right to preference in employment according to special law, where preference depends on how the previous employment relationship ended (for instance: if the employment relationship did not end due to the fault of the employee or through mutual agreement), a photocopy of evidence on the method of termination of the previous working relationship must be provided. Candidates invoking the right to preference in employment in accordance with Article 101 of the Law on Croatian Defenders of the Homeland War and Members of Their Families and Article 47 of the Law on Civil Victims of the Homeland War, in addition to the evidence of meeting the required conditions, are obliged to provide all necessary supporting documents available at the links of the Ministry of Croatian Defenders: https://branitelji.gov.hr/UserDocsImages//dokumenti/Nikola//popis%20dokaza%20za%20ostvarivanje%20prava%20prednosti%20pri%20zapo%C5%A1ljavanju-%20ZOHBDR%202021.pdf or https://branitelji.gov.hr/UserDocsImages/dokumenti/Nikola/popis%20dokaza%20za%20ostvarivanje%20prava%20prednosti%20pri%20zapo%C5%A1ljavanju-%20Zakon%20o%20civilnim%20stradalnicima%20iz%20DR.pdf Candidates invoking the right to preference according to Article 48.f of the Law on the Protection of Military and Civil Invalids of War must attach, in addition to the evidence of meeting the required conditions, a decision confirming the recognized status, or a letter confirming the recognized status indicating the right being invoked. Candidates invoking the right to preference in accordance with Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities must attach evidence of established status as a person with a disability. Candidates invoking the right to preference in accordance with Article 22 of the Constitutional Law on the Rights of National Minorities are not required to substantiate their status as a member of a national minority. The application for the competition must include: a CV, proof of Croatian citizenship (photocopy of a valid ID card, valid passport, citizenship certificate, or military ID), a photocopy of the diploma confirming the required level of education, a document obtained electronically confirming the data recorded in the registry of the Croatian Pension Insurance Institute (in case the insured person submitted the application electronically through the Croatian Pension Insurance Institute's user pages), or a certificate regarding the data in the register kept by the Croatian Pension Insurance Institute, obtainable directly from the offices of the Institute (not older than thirty days from the date of the competition announcement in the Official Gazette), a regular photocopy of the proof of work experience in relevant jobs for the entire period as stated in the public competition (decision on placement, employment contract, or employer's certificate of work experience in relevant jobs that must include: type of work performed, which profession and level of education was required for these jobs, and the time period in which the candidate performed the stated jobs), a photocopy of proof of passing the state exam at the required level (if the candidate has passed it), a photocopy of proof of knowledge of the Italian language - certificates from all grades of primary or secondary school in which Italian was a subject or an appropriate diploma (certificate) for completion of an Italian language course at level A1, a photocopy of evidence of computer skills (certificate on computer skills recognized in EU countries or certificate of qualification for Computer Operator in application business, or a certificate from the relevant grade of secondary school or grade listings from the university level showing that the information technology subject was successfully passed, or another appropriate confirmation from the authorized organizer of the computer course showing that the course was successfully completed, including basic computer operation and the Windows operating system, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Outlook - email and internet usage, and a hand-signed statement by the candidate that there are no obstacles for employment based on Articles 15 and 16 of the LSN (this statement does not need to be verified). If a candidate provides documents where personal data does not match, they must also provide evidence of their change (marriage certificate, birth certificate, etc.). The application must state the personal data of the applicant (name, surname, residential address, telephone number, or mobile phone, preferably email address) and specify the position for which the person is applying. The application must be personally signed. Candidates applying for multiple positions must submit a separate application for each position with all requested enclosures. Supplementary applications may be submitted until the end of the competition period. For assessing whether applicants meet the requirements stated in the competition, the last day of the application submission period will be decisive. Before deciding on a hiring decision, the selected candidate will be asked to provide, within a suitable timeframe, a certificate from the competent court confirming the absence of ongoing criminal proceedings against them and a medical certificate of fitness for performing the tasks related to the position they are being admitted to; they will also have to provide the originals for review of the evidence of fulfilling the formal conditions from the public competition, whose photocopies were attached to the application for the public competition. Failure to provide the requested documents is considered a withdrawal from the recruitment process. The costs of issuing the medical fitness certificate are borne by the City (except in the case of withdrawal from acceptance by the candidate). After the selection of candidates and before issuing the hiring decision, the City will officially check if there are any obstacles to hiring due to a previous conviction of the chosen candidate for a crime under Article 15 of the LSN and obstacles under Article 16 of the same law. Only applications that contain all the required details and documents specified in this competition will be considered. In the event of incomplete applications or those submitted after the specified deadline, they will not be valid for participation in the competition. In such cases, candidates will be notified in writing of the reasons preventing their participation in the competition, with no right to appeal. No request for supplementing incomplete applications is envisaged. Candidates who meet the competition requirements will be invited to undergo a preliminary assessment of knowledge and skills through written testing and interviews. If a candidate does not attend the preliminary assessment, they will be considered to have withdrawn their application for the competition. For candidates applying for public competition positions numbered 1 and 2, if they do not reside in the northwestern part of Istria, the City of Umag - Umago will finance accommodation in the area of the City of Umag - Umago or fully cover travel expenses. Applications with evidence of fulfilling the competition requirements must be submitted in closed envelopes to the address: City of Umag - Umago, Commission for Implementing the Competition, Trg slobode 7, 52470 Umag, within 15 days from the date of the competition announcement in the "Official Gazette," with the mandatory note "FOR COMPETITION FOR EMPLOYMENT (insert position title applied for) - DO NOT OPEN." Applications can also be submitted personally at the City of Umag - Umago office, Trg slobode 7 (ground floor). The decision on hiring the selected candidate will be published by public announcement on the official website of the City of Umag - Umago (www.umag.hr) no later than 60 days from the expiration date for the submission of applications for the public competition, and the delivery will be considered completed upon the expiration of the eighth day from the date of public announcement of the said decision. The job description and salary information for the position being filled by this competition, the method of conducting the preliminary assessment of candidates' knowledge and skills, the scope of the assessment, and legal and other resources for preparing candidates for the assessment are stated on the official website of the City of Umag - Umago www.umag.hr (location "Employment"). The time and location of the preliminary assessment will be published on the bulletin board of the City of Umag - Umago and on the official website www.umag.hr (location "Employment") at least five days prior to the assessment.

job_title: ASSISTANT FOR THE SCIENTIFIC FIELD OF NATURAL SCIENCES, FIELD OF MATHEMATICS (1.01)
full_description: Assistant in the scientific field of natural sciences, field of mathematics at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Applied Computing of the University of Dubrovnik, for performing scientific-research work on the project: "Conduction" - Optimal control and model reduction for evolution and data-driven problems. Conditions: according to the Law on Higher Education and Scientific Activity (Official Gazette, 119/2022). Special requirements: completed university graduate or integrated studies in mathematics or a related field is a prerequisite for enrollment in the doctoral study of mathematics. Candidates who already have a PhD cannot apply. Desired knowledge and skills include: experience in control theory, functional analysis, partial differential equations and/or machine learning, programming in Matlab or similar programming packages, ability to work in a team, excellent knowledge of written and spoken English. Applicants must submit, along with a signed application for the competition: - a CV (with a special indication of previous work experience and knowledge of foreign languages) - proof of citizenship - a copy of the diploma of appropriate educational qualifications - a transcript of grades for exams taken during studies - two recommendations. Applicants may also submit other documentation, particularly: - an overview of scientific, teaching, and professional activities - proof of knowledge of English - awards and recognitions for excellence in studies and research work - certificates of training or specialization in the profession. If a candidate has priority in employment according to special regulations, they must invoke this right in their application and submit all necessary documentation indicating this right, in accordance with special regulations. Candidates invoking priority in employment in accordance with the Law on Croatian War Veterans and their family members (Official Gazette, no. 121/17, 98/19, 84/21) are required to present documentation fulfilling the conditions. Candidates invoking priority in employment under the Law on Civilian Victims of War (Official Gazette, no. 84/21) must submit, along with the application for the public competition, not only proof of meeting the requested conditions but also all necessary documents from Article 49 of the mentioned law. Proofs required for achieving priority employment rights are listed at the following link: https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843. Candidates invoking priority in employment under the provisions of the Law on Protection of Military and Civilian Disabled Persons (Official Gazette, no. 33/92, 57/92, 77/92, 27/93, 58/93, 2/94, 76/94, 108/95, 108/96, 82/01, 103/03, 148/13, 98/19) are also required to submit, besides evidence of meeting the requested conditions, a decision or confirmation indicating such a right and proof of how their previous employment relationship has ended. Candidates invoking priority rights per the provisions of the Law on Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities (Official Gazette, no. 157/13, 152/14, 39/18, 32/20) must submit all necessary evidence of meeting the conditions requested, as well as proof of established disability status. Applications for this competition can be submitted by persons of both genders. The deadline for submitting applications lasts until December 15, 2025, and applications with evidence of meeting the conditions must be sent via the email address ured@unidu.hr. Late applications and applications without proof of the requested conditions will not be considered. The Committee for the Implementation of the Procedure for the Public Competition is appointed by the Rector of the University of Dubrovnik. The Committee determines the list of candidates who meet the formal requirements of the competition and refers them for interviews. This competition is published on the website of the University of Dubrovnik (www.unidu.hr). Candidates will be informed of the results of the competition within the legal timeframe. The University of Dubrovnik will publish information about the conducted procedure and selected applicant in accordance with regulations governing the protection of personal data, allowing all candidates access to the competition documentation. A contract for a fixed period will be concluded with the selected candidate in accordance with the Law on Higher Education and Scientific Activity, with a mandatory probationary period of six months. The University of Dubrovnik reserves the right to annul this competition without stating reasons.

GENERAL HOSPITAL VARAŽDIN Based on Article 24 of the Statute of the General Hospital Varaždin, Article 24 of the Basic Collective Agreement for Employees in Public Services ("Official Gazette" no. 29/24), and the consent of the Ministry of Health, the Director of the General Hospital Varaždin announces a COMPETITION for employment (m/f) higher IT officer – two (2) positions – for an indefinite period (which is translated into higher informatics under the Regulation on job titles, conditions for placement, and coefficients for salary calculation in public services ("Official Gazette" 22/24)). CONDITIONS: - VŠS, bachelor/bachelor of economic, IT or electrical engineering, bacc. Candidates are obliged to submit evidence of meeting the conditions of the competition in a copy/original and that: - diploma or certificate of completed required education - proof of citizenship - Curriculum Vitae in European format (Europass) - completed and signed consent form for the collection and processing of personal data. If the candidate has obtained an educational qualification abroad, they must submit a decision or confirmation from the competent state body regarding the recognition of foreign educational qualifications along with the application. If there is a need for an exam for acquiring certain knowledge and skills for the workplace or it is prescribed by special regulations, the worker may be employed under the condition that they pass the exam within one year of establishing the employment relationship; if the worker does not pass the exam within the mentioned time frame, their employment contract may be terminated. Candidates who will perform jobs in the healthcare sector cannot be accepted for employment in positions that provide direct healthcare protection and are involved in diagnostic and therapeutic procedures if they have had criminal proceedings initiated against them or have been convicted of any of the criminal offenses from Chapter XVI of the Criminal Code ("Official Gazette", no. 125/11, 144/12, 56/15, 61/15 - correction, 101/17, 118/18, 126/19, 84/21, 114/22, 114/23 and 36/24.) - Criminal offenses against sexual freedom and Chapter XVII of the same Law - Criminal offenses of sexual harassment and exploitation of children. The employer is obliged ex officio to obtain proof that the candidate has not been convicted of criminal offenses from Chapter XVI of the Criminal Code ("Official Gazette", no. 125/11, 144/12, 56/15, 61/15 - correction, 101/17, 118/18, 126/19, 84/21, 114/22, 114/23 and 36/24.) – Criminal offenses against sexual freedom and Chapter XVII of the same Law – Criminal offenses of sexual harassment and exploitation of children. full_description: Operator on a modern CNC sawing machine. Job description: operates a machine (bandsaw) for cutting logs, cuts logs according to professional standards. job_title: ENGINEER FOR DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF IP NETWORK - OPTICAL NETWORKS
full_description: Engineer for the development and maintenance of the IP network – optical networks (m/f) Optika kabel TV d.o.o. (OKTV) is a company engaged in the provision of electronic communication services (telephony, Internet, capacity leasing, OTT, WiFi networks) in the Croatian market. OKTV builds and has a complete network on its own optical infrastructure to the end user and offers access speeds of 1 Gbps and higher. If you are a team player, responsible and goal-oriented, and if you understand that without innovations there are no ovations, then this job advertisement is made for you. Your job will be: Development and maintenance of the IP network and network equipment and services including the central part of the network. Managing configuration and changes of network and information systems. Organizing and managing documentation, monitoring, and reviewing comprehensive configurations. Proactively monitoring the state and maintaining the network and services at the user level as well as using integrated telecommunications solutions which includes troubleshooting issues, implementing changes, and maintaining technical documentation, as well as creating and maintaining backups of network elements. Technical implementation of integrated telecommunications solutions for business users including fixed telephony and services related to data transfer and Internet in collaboration with the sales department (planning, execution, and monitoring) including processes of enrolling, disconnection, and changes. Establishing regular contacts and maintaining quality relationships with relevant technical staff at key customers as well as providing technical support to the sales department in organizing and presenting to users. Coordination of work with other organizational parts of the company, assigning work orders, and supervision and control of their execution. Preparation of reports for management and institutional needs. Internal training of employees as needed. We expect candidates to have: VSS/VŠS technical orientation (FER, Faculty of Transport Sciences, TVZ). 3-5 years of work experience in the same or similar jobs. Technical knowledge and experience at the CCNP level. Advanced knowledge of network technologies and protocols. Advanced knowledge of VoIP protocols, configuration of IP phones and platforms. Advanced experience in configuring, monitoring, and troubleshooting network devices from one of the following manufacturers: Cisco, HP, Huawei, Mikrotik, Fortinet, ZTE (GPON). Independence in executing work tasks. User-oriented approach. Communication skills. Excellent knowledge of working in MS Office applications. Preference is given to candidates who have passed a security check. Knowledge of English in writing and speaking. A driver's license category B. We offer: a pleasant work environment and an ambitious team, education and training, the possibility of development and application of creative ideas, a financial package of net €2,400.00 – €3,000.00 depending on experience and business results, additional benefits depending on experience and agreement, working hours 08:00 - 16:00 h, Place of work: Zaprešić.

TECHNIC is a company specializing in the design, assembly of industrial machines and plants, production and assembly of assembly elements, and fabrication of pipelines. We gather a team of experienced professionals and engineers who follow global technological trends and achievements. We employ a range of highly educated experts and highly qualified workers engaged in numerous energy projects across Europe. CONDITIONS: Ability to work with measuring and testing devices. Reliability, precision, and responsible approach to work. Desirable experience in quality control or similar jobs (not a requirement). Job description: Use of devices for testing metal components. Cleanliness control of metal components. Control of parts of metal components. Weld inspection on metal components. Control of pre-assembly of metal components. Control of metal components after coating. Measuring dimensions of metal components and parts according to technical documentation. Recording testing results and filling in control forms. Identifying deviations and reporting irregularities to the production or quality control manager. Collaboration with assemblers and the production team in solving identified issues. Performing basic visual and functional tests of products. Using basic measuring tools (caliper, ruler, micrometer, measuring templates, etc.). Preparing metal components for testing (cleaning, positioning, marking). Control of protective coatings and finishing of products. Ensuring product compliance with safety and quality standards. Monitoring and adhering to quality control procedures. Maintaining cleanliness and orderliness of the workspace. Occasionally participating in internal testing of new control procedures. We offer: Stable job in a growing company. Work in a pleasant and established team. Possibility of additional training.

job_title: ASSOCIATE PROFESSOR AT THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH ECOLOGY
full_description: Job description: organizes and conducts teaching in subjects that fall within the scientific field or branch for which they are selected, mentors undergraduate, graduate, professional, and postgraduate students, participates in scientific research and professional work. The Faculty of Medicine in Rijeka announces a JOB VACANCY for the selection of a scientist to a scientific-teaching position of associate professor in the scientific field of biomedicine and health, scientific field of public health and healthcare, scientific branch of health ecology, at the Department of Health Ecology of the Faculty of Medicine in Rijeka, in the teaching base of the Public Health Institute of Primorje-Gorski Kotar County, for an indefinite period, part-time – 10 hours per week (for 50% teaching obligations). Candidates for the vacancy must meet the requirements specified by the Law on Higher Education and Scientific Activity and the Decision on the necessary conditions for the evaluation of teaching and scientific-professional activities in the selection process for scientific-teaching titles of the Rector's Council and the National Council for Science, Higher Education and Technological Development, the Regulations on the Conditions for Selection to Scientific Titles of the National Council for Science, Higher Education and Technological Development, and the Regulations on Additional Conditions for Selection to Scientific-Teaching Positions in the Field of Biomedicine and Health of the Faculty of Medicine in Rijeka. Candidates applying for the scientific-teaching position must submit documentation according to: Instructions for Writing Applications for Selection to Scientific-Teaching Titles (available on the Faculty's website) • CV, description of scientific-teaching activities, confirmation of the evaluation of the student survey (not applicable for selections to assistant professors), health capability certificate from a certified occupational medicine physician, submitted exclusively in PDF format. Applications for the vacancy can be submitted by persons of both genders (Article 13, Paragraph 2 of the Gender Equality Act, NN 82/08, 69/17). By submitting an application for the vacancy, the candidate gives consent for all their personal data contained in the application documentation to be collected and processed for the purpose of conducting the vacancy in accordance with regulations governing the protection of personal data. Candidates who invoke special regulations for employment preferences must in their application refer to this right and attach all evidence prescribed by special regulations for achieving this right. Such candidates gain preference in employment over other candidates only under equal conditions. Candidates entitled to preferential employment according to the Law on Croatian Veterans from the Homeland War and their families, the Law on Civilian Casualties from the Homeland War, must refer to this right in their application and attach evidence of meeting these conditions. Candidates whose native language is not Croatian must provide proof of knowledge of the Croatian language (level B2) according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages. Candidates who obtained their education outside the Republic of Croatia must submit an opinion from the relevant agency on the acquired foreign professional qualification. The Faculty reserves the right to verify the knowledge and skills of candidates who submit a timely and orderly application and meet the formal requirements of the vacancy before making a decision, through testing and/or interviews. If a candidate does not attend the verification, it will be considered that they have withdrawn their application for the vacancy. The Faculty reserves the right to partially or fully cancel the vacancy and not to select any candidates without special explanation. Late and incomplete applications will not be considered.

job_title: EMPLOYEE FOR BUILDING AND ENERGY MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT
full_description: WE ARE HIRING PERSON FOR THE POSITION: Building and Energy Management. As a family business, we know that people contribute to our success with their knowledge and skills. We return this with stimulating compensation and a corporate culture that lives family values. We want to be more than just a group of teams in one company. Mutual cooperation means mutual connection for us. We all agree that together we achieve great things. As a company. As a team. As a family. Preferred but not required: Professional examination for handling and testing pressure vessels and compressors. Excellent knowledge of legal regulations in the field of responsibility. Minimum 3 years of experience in the same or similar jobs. Good knowledge of MS Office. Flexibility, good organizational skills, proactivity in performing tasks. Job description: Management of company buildings. Waste management and care for the recycling yard and environmental management. Cooperation with external contractors. Supervision and collaboration during the performance of works by external companies and handover after completion of works. Planning and implementing activities that contribute to the sustainable development of the facility, including energy efficiency, use of renewable energy sources, and reduction of adverse environmental impact. Monitoring, recording, and organizing the removal of identified deficiencies during the regular execution of technical, safety, and firefighting operations in the facility. Regular inspections of property and their correctness. What you can expect: Permanent contract. Stimulating salary. Supportive and friendly work atmosphere. Work in a dynamic environment. Introduction to work under mentorship. Extensive benefits package (e.g. team building, Christmas party, sports activities, 24/7 insurance, contributions to the 3rd pension pillar, and many more perks).

Job description: - collecting production orders to adhere to delivery times and department efficiency - planning and releasing production orders into production - monitoring production phases - with the plant manager - reporting deviations in production - with the plant manager - preparing documentation for the plant - analyzing production balance and its deviation from theoretical time. Employer offers: - stimulating salaries, meals, travel expenses, additional €1000 net occasional rewards per year - every year a monetary gift for each child up to 15 years of age in the amount of €130 net - jubilee awards - regular salary increases, laptop, mobile phone - positive working environment.

Job description: •participation in the entire process of construction and repair of automotive tires •final inspection of tires and mounting on vehicles •work on machines for mounting and balancing automotive tires with prior training and mentorship •storage of automotive tires in the storage space
control and replacement of tires on vehicles, repair of damaged tires and inner tubes (vulcanization), and balancing of wheels using special machines and tools, HEAVY VEHICLES AND PASSENGER CARS

Job description: Preparation of raw materials for turning Control and preparation of the machine for operation Removal of positions from the machine and preparation for further processing Performing minor service and inspection tasks Independent execution of received work orders Diligent tracking and monitoring of working hours Conditions: Completed secondary school (SSS) Minimum 1-3 years of experience in the same or similar jobs (lathe, band saw, radial drill) Knowledge of working on a lathe Knowledge and reading of technical drawings Willingness to work independently and in a team The employer offers: Work with professional tools and equipment Free hot meal in the company canteen Holiday bonuses and other occasional rewards Full travel expenses Use of sports centers Discounts on services from our business partners More favorable financial services in cooperation with banks Additional and supplementary health insurance

We are looking for an independent turner, working on NC and CNC lathes, knowledge and reading of technical drawings. Production facility BOŽJAKOVINA. Possibility of additional training and advancement. Work in a young and dynamic environment.

We are looking for a reliable and independent maintenance worker who will take care of the arrangement and cleanliness of outdoor surfaces. Job description: mowing grass, trimming plants, maintaining gardens and green areas, cleaning driveways and paths, maintaining tools, as well as reporting any damage or repair needs. Experience in gardening or environmental maintenance and ability to work with basic tools and machines is desirable, but not a requirement.

We are looking for a proactive, team-oriented, motivated, and communicative person who is open to new ideas and approaches, and who shows a willingness to acquire new knowledge and skills in a business environment. Become part of our expert team of 30 creatives who share a passion for innovation, simplicity, and modern trends. Key responsibilities and tasks of the project manager: 1. Plans, organizes, and manages project development and delivery. Plans, organizes, and manages development and ensures project delivery. Creates project plans, timelines, and manages resource allocation. Creates (writes) technical project documentation for project needs. 2. Serves as the main contact point for clients, ensuring clear and consistent communication. Assigns and distributes tasks within the team. Facilitates communication between team members and the client. Ensures compliance with project objectives. 3. Ensures that development teams are well-informed and works on organizing and accurately entering tasks into the backlog. Identifies potential risks and addresses them in a timely manner. 4. Prepares project documentation and sets objectives according to client needs, including scope, timeline, and budget. Monitors project profitability. Ensures efficient resource utilization. Optimizes team productivity. We are looking for: Experience in project management in software development, e-commerce platforms, and mobile applications. At least 3+ years of experience working in an agency environment - working on multiple different projects (e-commerce, mobile app, software). Experience working with a minimum of 10 different clients. Excellent knowledge of technical terminology used in the IT industry and digital product development. Excellent knowledge of CRM and PM tools and concepts related to agile team management. Excellent organizational skills. Excellent verbal communication with an emphasis on technology (technical part of development). Excellent technical knowledge required for creating project documentation related to client requirements. Ability to handle stressful situations. Creating a positive and winning work atmosphere. Proactivity in work and a need for continuous learning. Responsibility. Additionally: Knowledge of working in Productive, using the bbc email inbox in communication, automation forms for obtaining information from clients, using client view. Using/knowledge of AI tools, transcribers, voice recorders, code tools for prototyping, PM tools, ChatGPT for writing documentation. What do we offer? Work in a dynamic team, continuous development and education, flexibility and sliding working hours, the most fun team building.

What would your role be? Participation in all processes related to fishing, anchoring, and fish manipulation. Stocking, grabbing, and flipping fish, loading and unloading all necessary materials. Setting up protective nets and preparing cages for towing. Cleaning anchoring systems and replacing all worn components. Preparing fish and cages for catch. Patching holes in catching nets, preparing, cutting, and twisting ropes. Do you identify with this description? You are at an advantage if you possess a seafarer book (matricula). You are inclined towards teamwork and working outdoors. You are ready to work on weekends. You enjoy working in a dynamic environment. We offer you: A maritime allowance on a daily sailing basis. Competitive earnings and work in a dynamic environment. Monthly salary supplement for work performance. Monthly salary supplement for working conditions. Organized warm meal (subsidized by the employer) or meal allowance, depending on the employee's choice. Possibility of organized shared accommodation or accommodation subsidy. Paid transportation costs. Christmas bonus, Easter bonus, and severance pay. A gift for a child during the Christmas holidays. Quarterly bonuses based on business results and individual contributions. Loyalty award for long service. Paid leave and monetary assistance in cases defined by the Collective Agreement.

Job description: - tasks of disinfection, pest control, and rodent control - experience is desirable but not necessary, training provided - work in Zagreb and surroundings, no fieldwork - B category required - official mobile phone, official car - weekends off, no overtime - starting salary €1100-1300, depending on experience and level of education - payment of bonuses for good results, Christmas bonus, annual leave according to labor law - possibility of accommodation payment by the employer, by agreement.

Based on Article 24 of the Statute of the General Hospital Nova Gradiška, I announce a JOB COMPETITION for establishing an employment relationship for an indefinite period - graduate bachelor of medical laboratory diagnostics, 1 position. Professional requirements: undergraduate university or professional study of medical laboratory diagnostics, license for independent work. Along with the application to the competition, it is mandatory to attach: CV, proof of acquired professional qualification for the requested job - copy of diploma, copy of license for independent work, copy of proof of citizenship, copy of birth certificate, copy of ID card, proof of work experience (electronic record of employment status - e-work book or confirmation from the Croatian Pension Insurance Institute, no older than a month from the date of announcement of the competition). Certificate from the competent court that no criminal proceedings are pending concerning Chapter XVI of the Criminal Code ("Official Gazette" no: 125/11, 144/12, 56/15, 61/15 - corrections, 101/17, 118/18, 126/19, 84/21, 114/22, 114/23, and 36/24) Criminal acts against sexual freedom and Chapter XVII of the same Law - Criminal acts of sexual abuse and exploitation of a child (the court certificate must be issued during the application period for this competition). In the application for the competition, candidates are required to state which job they are applying for. Persons who, according to special regulations, have the right of preference must refer to this right in their application or submit all prescribed documentation according to a special law. If a candidate claims the right of preference according to Article 102 of the Law on Croatian Veterans of the Homeland War and their families ("Official Gazette" no. 121/17, 98/19, 84/21 and 156/23), Article 48 of the Law on Civilian Victims of the Homeland War, and Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities, they must state the right of preference in the application and have the right of preference compared to other candidates under equal conditions. Candidates claiming the right of preference in employment according to Article 102 of the Law on Croatian Veterans of the Homeland War and their families must, along with their application, in addition to proving compliance with the job requirements, submit all the documentation prescribed by Article 103 paragraph 1 of the Law, which can also be found at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843. If a candidate claims the right of preference in employment according to Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities, they must include proof of established status as a person with disabilities in their application, as well as a confirmation from the last employer regarding the manner of termination of the previous employment. Candidates who meet the formal requirements of the competition for job number 1) will be invited for a preliminary knowledge, skills, inclinations, and abilities test essential for performing the jobs of the position they have applied for. The preliminary check will be determined by a written test of professional knowledge essential for performing the job and an interview. Candidates will be informed of the date of testing and interviews (at least 5 days before the event), work materials for the preliminary check, and the results of the competition via the official website of the General Hospital Nova Gradiška (www.bolnicang.hr). The day of the posting on the website is considered the day of receipt of notice/invitation/decision. Candidates who do not attend the specified check will be considered to have withdrawn their application for the competition. In the event of an equal number of points, preference will be given to the candidate who holds the right of preference in employment in accordance with one of the above laws. By applying to the competition, you consent to the processing of your personal data for employment purposes, in accordance with the provisions of positive regulations governing the protection of personal data. The General Hospital Nova Gradiška reserves the right to cancel the competition, or the right not to select any candidate without justification for its decision and without any responsibility to the candidates. Applications must be submitted within 8 days from the date of publication of the competition in the Official Gazette, in person or by postal delivery to the address: General Hospital Nova Gradiška, Strossmayerova 17A, Nova Gradiška, in a sealed envelope marked "For establishing an employment relationship - (specify the name of the position)." Both genders may apply for the competition. Incomplete, late applications, and applications without the specified job position will not be considered.

job_title: 13. HEALTH WORKER HEALTH LABORATORY TECHNICIAN IN HOSPITAL 1 FOR THE NEEDS OF THE CLINICAL INSTITUTE FOR MICROBIOLOGY AND PARASITOLOGY
full_description: Based on the decision of the director of the Clinical Hospital Center Split, a JOB COMPETITION is announced for employment (m/f) EMPLOYMENT FOR AN INDEFINITE PERIOD 13. HEALTHWORKER HEALTH LABORATORY TECHNICIAN IN HOSPITAL 1 for the needs of the Clinical Department of Microbiology and Parasitology - 1 position. Requirements: Secondary school health school health laboratory technician approval for independent work. When applying for the competition, candidates are required to submit: application, CV, copy of the completed school certificate, copy of the approval for independent work. For the jobs numbered 1, 15, 16, 17, a probation period of six (6) months is established; for the jobs numbered 8, 9, 10, 18, and 19, a probation period of three (3) months is established; for the jobs numbered 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 11, 12, 13, 14, 20, 21, 22, 23, a probation period of two (2) months is established; for the jobs numbered 24, 25, and 26, a probation period of one (1) month is established. Candidates must submit the required documents exclusively in unverified copies, which will not be returned. Late applications, applications with incomplete documentation, and those in which the job position and type of employment are not clearly indicated in the application will be excluded from consideration. After the announcement of the Decision on Employment, candidates can collect the competition documentation within 30 days at the Human Resources Management Service. After the deadline, uncollected competition documentation will be destroyed. Candidates must provide a decision on the recognition of a foreign educational qualification issued by an authorized institution of the Republic of Croatia if the qualification, i.e., appropriate level of education and profession was obtained abroad. If a person applies for several job positions, they are required to submit complete requested documentation for each job position. KBC Split reserves the right to additional testing or interviews with candidates, and the call for written testing or interviews will be published on the KBC Split website. Candidates are required to monitor published calls for written testing or interviews on the KBC Split Job Competition website. In accordance with the Gender Equality Act, persons of both genders may apply for the competition. A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment in accordance with Articles 102 and 103 of the Law on Croatian Veterans of the Homeland War and their families, when applying for the Competition, must, in addition to proving compliance with the requested conditions, also attach all necessary evidence available at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans: https://gov.hr/hr/prednost-pri-zaposljavanju/916. A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment in accordance with Article 48.f. of the Act on the Protection of War Veterans and Civilian Invalids of War, when applying for the Competition, must, in addition to proving compliance with the requested conditions, also attach all necessary evidence from Article 48.f. of the cited Law available at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans: https://gov.hr/hr/prednost-pri-zaposljavanju/916. A candidate who invokes the right of preference in employment under Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities must, when applying for the competition, in addition to proof of compliance with the requested requirements, also attach proof of the established status as a person with disabilities, which is considered public documents on disability based on which the person can be registered in the register of employed persons with disabilities, as well as proof of the manner of termination of the employment relationship with the last employer. Applications completed with the necessary evidence proving compliance with the competition requirements along with the specified documentation marked "For Competition" must be sent by mail to the Clinical Hospital Center Split, Vjekoslava Spinčića 1, Split, or directly to the Reception Office at the same address. Personal data of candidates are processed for the purpose of conducting the selection procedure for employment in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (hereinafter: the Regulation) and applicable laws. If there is a need to exercise rights under the Regulation, the candidate can contact KBC at the email: gdpr@kbsplit.hr. Candidates who meet the formal requirements of the competition will be invited for an interview/test in a manner that will state the candidate's name and at least the first three letters of the last name. The call will be published on the KBC Split's website. KBC Split reserves the right to cancel the Competition entirely as well as a part of the Competition without stating the reasons for cancellation. The deadline for submitting the application is eight (8) days from the date of announcement of the Competition.

job_title: 12. HEALTH WORKER HEALTH LABORATORY TECHNICIAN/TECHNICIAN IN HOSPITAL 1 FOR THE NEEDS OF THE CLINICAL DEPARTMENT OF NUCLEAR MEDICINE
full_description: Based on the decision of the director of the Clinical Hospital Center Split, a COMPETITION is announced for employment (m/f) EMPLOYMENT FOR AN INDEFINITE PERIOD 12. HEALTH WORKER HEALTH LABORATORY TECHNICIAN IN HOSPITAL 1 for the needs of the Clinical Institute of Nuclear Medicine - 1 executor Conditions: Secondary School Diploma in health, health laboratory technician, approval for independent work Upon applying for the competition, candidates are obliged to submit: application, CV, photocopy of the school certificate, photocopy of the approval for independent work For job positions under numbers 1, 15, 16, 17, a probation period has been set for six (6) months, for job positions under numbers 8, 9, 10, 18, and 19, a probation period has been set for three (3) months, for job positions under numbers 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 11, 12, 13, 14, 20, 21, 22, 23, a probation period has been set for two (2) months, for job positions under numbers 24, 25, and 26, a probation period has been set for one (1) month. Candidates must submit the required documents exclusively in unverified photocopies, which will not be returned. Late applications, applications with incomplete documentation, as well as those in which it is not clearly indicated in the application what job position and type of employment the person is applying for, will be excluded from consideration, and the competition documentation after the announcement of the Decision on employment can be picked up within 30 days at the Human Resources Management Service. After the deadline, uncollected competition documentation will be destroyed. Candidates are obliged to attach a decision on the recognition of foreign educational qualifications issued by an authorized institution of the Republic of Croatia if the qualification, i.e. the relevant level of education and profession, was obtained abroad. If a person applies for the competition for multiple job positions, they are required to submit complete requested documentation for each job position. KBC Split reserves the right to additional testing or interviews with candidates, and the invitation for written testing or interviews will be published on the KBC Split website. Candidates are obliged to follow the announcements of invitations for written testing or interviews on the KBC Split website Job Competition. According to the Gender Equality Act, both sexes can apply for the Competition. The candidate who claims the right of preference for employment in accordance with articles 102 and 103 of the Law on Croatian War Veterans and their family members, along with the application for the Competition, is obliged, in addition to evidence that they meet the required conditions, to attach all necessary evidence available at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans: https://gov.hr/hr/prednost-pri-zaposljavanju/916 The candidate who claims the right of preference for employment in accordance with article 48.f. of the Law on the Protection of Military and Civil War Invalids, in addition to evidence that they meet the required conditions, is obliged to attach all necessary evidence from article 48.f. of the cited Law available at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans: https://gov.hr/hr/prednost-pri-zaposljavanju/916 The candidate who claims the right of preference for employment in accordance with article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities along with the application for the competition is obliged, in addition to evidence that they meet the required conditions, to attach proof of established status as a person with disabilities, with public documents on disability being considered as proof, based on which the person can be registered in the register of employed persons with disabilities, as well as proof of how the employment relationship was terminated with the last employer. Applications completed with the necessary evidence of meeting the conditions from the competition with the specified documentation marked 'For the Competition' should be sent by mail to the address: Clinical Hospital Center Split, Vjekoslava Spinčića 1, Split or submitted directly to the Admission Office at the same address. Personal data of candidates will be processed for the purpose of conducting the selection process for employment in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (hereinafter: Regulation) and applicable laws. In case of need to exercise rights from the Regulation, the candidate can contact KBC at the email: gdpr@kbsplit.hr. Candidates who meet the formal requirements of the competition will be invited for an interview/testing in such a way that the name and at least the first three letters of the candidate's last name will be indicated. The invitation will be published on the KBC Split website. KBC Split reserves the right to cancel the Competition in its entirety, as well as part of the Competition without stating the reasons for cancellation. The deadline for submitting applications is eight (8) days from the date of publication of the Competition.
