Job description: Preparation and analysis of samples according to professional standards Working with laboratory equipment and devices Participation in the quality assurance process of laboratory tests Maintenance of laboratory documentation and work in LIS (Laboratory Information System) Collaboration with other members of the medical team The employer expects: Completed program for health laboratory technician or completed undergraduate study in medical laboratory diagnostics (bacc. med. lab. diag.) Passed professional exam and valid license to work Experience in laboratory work (an advantage, but not a requirement) Reliability, precision, and a tendency towards teamwork The employer offers: Work in a modernly equipped laboratory with modern diagnostic devices Possibility of professional development and advancement Stimulating compensation and a pleasant working atmosphere Participation in the implementation and improvement of the quality system

Job description: Preparation and analysis of samples according to professional standards. Working with laboratory equipment and devices. Participation in the process of ensuring the quality of laboratory tests. Maintenance of laboratory documentation and working in LIS (Laboratory Information System). Collaboration with other members of the medical team. Employer expects: Completed program for health-laboratory technician or completed undergraduate study of medical-laboratory diagnostics (bacc. med. lab. diag.). Passed professional exam and valid work license. Experience in laboratory work (preferred, but not a condition). Reliability, precision, and inclination towards teamwork. Employer offers: Work in a modernly equipped laboratory with modern diagnostic devices. Opportunities for professional training and development. Stimulating remuneration and a pleasant working atmosphere. Participation in the implementation and improvement of the quality system.

job_title: WORKER III. TYPES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANT/LABORATORY ASSISTANT AT THE MEDICAL FACULTY OSIJEK
company_name: University of Osijek, Faculty of Medicine Osijek
full_description: JOSEPH JURAI STROSSMAYER UNIVERSITY IN OSIJEK MEDICAL FACULTY OSIJEK announces COMPETITION for the selection of one (1) employee for a specialized job in the system of science and higher education, Type III job, technical assistant - laboratory technician for an indefinite period of full-time work at the Department of Medical Biology and Genetics at the Medical Faculty in Osijek as part of the Joseph Juraj Strossmayer University in Osijek. Candidates for the competition for the selection of an employee for the position of technical assistant - laboratory technician must meet the general conditions prescribed by the Labor Law ('Narodne novine' No. 93/14, 127/17, 98/19, 151/22 and 64/23) and the following conditions: secondary school education in a technical field (HKO level 4.2), one year of work experience. Along with the written application for the competition, candidates for the position of technical assistant - laboratory technician are required to submit: a CV, original or certified copy of the certificate of completed secondary education (certified copies may be certified by a notary public or the institution that issued the certificate), copy of identification document, electronic record of social security data from HZMO (e-workbook), not older than the day of publication of this competition, attached relevant proof of work experience (copy of employment contract or other relevant proof of job types and duration of employment), filled and signed Consent Form for the collection and processing of personal data for the purpose of implementing the competition published on the website of the Medical Faculty Osijek www.mefos.unios.hr. On the website of the Joseph Juraj Strossmayer University in Osijek, Medical Faculty Osijek www.mefos.unios.hr there is a job description for the position of technical assistant - laboratory technician. Documentation must be submitted in two (2) copies. Candidates for the competition for the selection for the position of technical assistant - laboratory technician who meet the formal requirements of the competition and who have submitted binding documentation with the application must undergo written testing and/or interview, and they will be notified about the place and time of the written testing and/or interview via email from the Medical Faculty Osijek no later than five (5) days before the interview. All information about the election process will be published on the website of the Medical Faculty Osijek www.mefos.unios.hr. For candidates who do not attend the interview before the Committee, it is considered that they have withdrawn their application from the competition and will not be considered candidates for the competition. For candidates who are foreign nationals, it is necessary to submit proof of knowledge of the Croatian language in accordance with the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages, advanced knowledge (C2). Candidates who invoke their right of priority in employment under special regulations - the Law on Croatian Veterans of the Homeland War and their family members ('Narodne novine' No. 121/17, 98/19 and 84/21), Article 48 of the Law on Civilian Victims of the Homeland War ('Narodne novine' No. 84/21) and Article 48.f. of the Law on the Protection of Military and Civilian War Invalids ('Narodne novine' No. 33/92, 57/92, 77/92, 27/93, 58/93, 2/94, 76/94, 108/95, 108/96, 82/01, 103/03, 148/13 and 98/19) Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities ('Narodne novine' No. 157/13, 152/14, 39/18 and 32/20) must refer to that right in their application and provide all evidence that special regulations require for the realization of that right. Candidates listed above gain an advantage in employment compared to other candidates, only under equal conditions. For candidates who reference their right to priority in employment according to the Law on Croatian Veterans of the Homeland War and their family members ('Narodne novine' No. 121/17, 98/19 and 84/21) and the Law on Civilian Victims of the Homeland War ('Narodne novine' No. 84/21) a list of required documents to exercise that right is available at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans: https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843. Candidates invoking their right to priority in employment pursuant to Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities ('Narodne novine' No. 157/13, 152/14, 39/18 and 32/20) in their application must invoke that right and submit all evidence of meeting the necessary requirements as well as proof of disability. Individuals of both genders can apply for the competition under equal conditions. Only individuals who submit a timely and complete application and meet the formal requirements of the competition will be considered candidates. A complete application is considered an application that contains all the data and attachments listed in this competition and is personally signed by the candidate who submitted the application for the public competition. Late and incomplete applications will not be considered. By applying for the Competition, the candidate gives consent for all their personal data included in the application documentation to be collected and processed for the purpose of conducting the competition in accordance with regulations governing the protection of personal data, especially Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and Council of April 27, 2016, on the protection of individuals regarding the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation). Candidates for the Contest are required to attach a filled and signed Consent Form for the collection and processing of personal data for the purposes of the competition along with their application. The Consent Form is published with the competition on the website of the Medical Faculty Osijek www.mefos.unios.hr. Without a duly completed and signed Consent Form submitted with the application for the Competition, the application will be considered incomplete and will not be taken into consideration. All candidates for the Contest will be notified about the results of the Contest within fifteen (15) days from the date of its completion. The Medical Faculty Osijek reserves the right to inform all registered candidates also via email. Applications with proof of meeting the competition conditions must be submitted within 8 days from the date of the publication of the competition in 'Narodne novine' to the address: Joseph Juraj Strossmayer University in Osijek, Medical Faculty Osijek, Josipa Huttlera 4, 31000 Osijek, with the note: 'application for the competition for the position of technical assistant - laboratory technician'.

job_title: HEALTH WORKER - PRIMARY MEDICAL LABORATORY DIAGNOSTICS IN HOSPITAL
full_description: Health worker - Bachelor of Medical Laboratory Diagnostics at a hospital for the purposes of working in the Institute of Clinical Microbiology and Hospital Infections - 1 executor. Conditions: completed undergraduate study of medical-laboratory diagnostics; Bachelor of Medical Laboratory Diagnostics (bacc.med.lab.diagn.), approval for independent work, one year of work experience. Candidates are required to submit the following with their application: application letter, CV, copies of diploma, copy of certificate of average grade during studies or supplement to diploma with average grade during studies, copy of approval for independent work, copy of proof of citizenship, HZMO certificate on work-legal status (e-workbook), not older than the date of publication of the competition, copy of marriage certificate or other relevant proof in case of a name change of the candidate, certificate of no criminal record. Candidates who meet the conditions of the competition and who have submitted a correct application with all requested proof of meeting the conditions will be tested/interviewed as needed, depending on the number of candidates who applied. Candidates will be informed about the method of conducting testing/interviews, sources for candidate preparation, time of testing/interview, and any additional required documentation through announcements on the official website of KBC Osijek (www.kbco.hr) and on the bulletin board. Applications with proof of meeting the competition conditions must be submitted within eight (8) days from the date of publication of the competition to: Clinical Hospital Center Osijek - Directorate, J. Huttlera 4, 31 000 Osijek, with the indication of the position for which the candidate is applying. The candidate must submit as many applications as the positions they are applying for. Any additions to the competition documentation must be submitted in the same manner as prescribed for the application with proof of meeting the competition conditions and within the competition timeframe. Both genders may apply for the competition (Article 13, paragraph 2 of the Gender Equality Act NN No.: 82/08, 125/11, 20/12, 138/12, 69/17). By submitting the application for the competition, the applicants explicitly agree that KBC Osijek, as the personal data collection manager, may collect, use, and further process the data for the purpose of conducting the competition in accordance with the regulations governing the protection of personal data. Late and incomplete applications will not be considered. Candidates who gain priority in employment under equal conditions according to special regulations are required to invoke that right in their application, along with the obligatory submission of proof of that right. Candidates who qualify for employment priority per Article 48 of the Law on Civilian Victims of the Homeland War (NN 84/21) are invited to submit evidence as per Article 49 of the said law for the purpose of exercising employment priority. A list of required documents for exercising the right to employment priority is available at the link of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans of the Republic of Croatia: https://branitelji.gov.hr/UserDocsImages/dokumenti/Nikola/popis%20dokaza%20za%20ostvarivanje%20prava%20prednosti%20pri%20zapo%C5%A1ljavanju-%20Zakon%20o%20civilnim%20stradalnicima%20iz%20DR.pdf. Candidates who qualify for employment priority per Article 102, paragraphs 1-3 of the Law on Croatian Veterans of the Homeland War and members of their families NN (121/17, 98/19, 84/21, 156/23) are required to submit all necessary evidence per Article 103, paragraph 1 of the said law to exercise employment priority. A list of documents required to exercise employment priority is available on the website of the Ministry of Croatian Veterans of the Republic of Croatia, link: https://branitelji.gov.hr/UserDocsImages//dokumenti/Nikola//popis%20dokaza%20za%20ostvarivanje%20prava%20prednosti%20pri%20zapo%C5%A1ljavanju-%20ZOHBDR%202021.pdf. Candidates claiming priority in employment pursuant to Article 9 of the Law on Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities (NN 157/13, 152/14, 39/18, 32/20) are required to refer to Article 9 of the same law and submit proof of meeting the competition requirements along with recognition of their status as a person with disabilities per the Regulation on the content and method of keeping a record of employed persons with disabilities, as well as proof of how the employment relationship ended with the last employer. Work experience in the profession of relevant jobs is considered work experience gained in tasks of appropriate professional qualification, that is, profession, post acquiring that qualification. All candidates will be notified of the results of the competition within the legal timeframe via the official website of KBC Osijek. The date of publication on the website is considered the date of receipt of the notice/invitation/decision. It is considered that a candidate has withdrawn from the competition if they have not attended the testing/interview. The hospital reserves the right to cancel the competition or not choose any candidate without explanation of its decision and without any liability to the candidates. The competition documentation, or the data of candidates KBC Osijek will be stored for six months after the completion of the competition, and longer in case of judicial or similar proceedings. After the expiration of the indicated storage period, the documentation will be destroyed, provided each candidate may collect their documentation by the end of the storage period. Candidates who have applied for the position: cleaner/maid in systems with special working conditions and auxiliary worker in systems with special working conditions and who will be chosen will be invited before signing the employment contract to provide a Certificate of health capacity to perform the tasks of the workplace with a warning and condition that in case they do not submit a Certificate of health capacity or they submit it but it demonstrates that they do not meet the health capacity conditions indicated for that workplace, this will represent a reason for not entering into an employment contract.

job_title: EXPERT ASSOCIATE FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF WILDLIFE PROTECTION PROGRAMS
company_name: Institution ZOOLOGICAL GARDEN OF THE CITY OF ZAGREB
full_description: The Zagreb City Zoo announces a JOB ADVERTISEMENT for establishing an employment relationship for the position: 1. Expert Associate for the Implementation of the Wildlife Protection Program for the City of Zagreb (M/F). 1 executor for an indefinite period, full-time. Words and terms that have a gender meaning used in this advertisement refer equally to male and female genders regardless of whether they have been used in the male or female gender. Conditions: • Secondary vocational qualification (SSS), • Qualification for the jobs of a hunter, • Possession of a valid hunting license, • Possession of a valid firearms license for the possession and carrying of weapon for hunting purposes • Knowledge of PC operation and OFFICE programs • Possession of a driving license B category, • Work experience is not a condition. Probation period: 6 months. Job description of the expert associate: • independently according to the instructions of the expert for wildlife protection or the head of the department, together with the expert for wildlife protection or under their supervision, performs all tasks within the remit of the expert for wildlife protection • performs other tasks in accordance with the nature and type of work of their position, professional qualification and work experience. We invite all interested candidates who meet the conditions to submit an application for the advertisement. Applications should be sent to the email address posao@zoo.hr by December 18, 2025, by 24:00. The application must be accompanied by an unverified copy of: 1. CV (indicating contact details) 2. Proof of the appropriate professional qualification from which it can be determined that the candidate meets the qualifications for selection to the appropriate job position 3. Proof of meeting the conditions for performing the tasks of a hunter from Article 59, paragraph (2) of the Hunting Act (certificate of competency for hunter or copy of hunter’s license) 4. Proof of possession of a B category driving license. Interested candidates may also submit other evidence proving that they meet the conditions. Both genders may apply for the advertisement equally (Article 13 of the Gender Equality Act, NN 82/08, 69/17). A candidate who invokes the right of priority according to a special law in their application is obliged to submit all prescribed documentation according to the special law and has priority over other candidates under equal conditions. The advertisement is published on the web portal of the Croatian Employment Service. Candidates will be informed about the results via the website of the Institution, the Zagreb City Zoo www.zoo.hr. The Zagreb City Zoo reserves the right not to accept any application from candidates.

Organizational unit: Production, Fertilizer Production Department. Job description: Participation in the handover of shifts with the process worker from the previous shift. Inspection of the plant, reading process parameters, entering data into work lists. Occasionally participating in monitoring the production process at the control panel according to work instructions. Recording the results of daily analyses. Quality control. Taking samples under expert supervision. Informing the shift supervisor about observed disruptions and faults in the production process. Participating under expert supervision in handling equipment at the workplace during start-up, normal operation, and shutdown of the plant. Taking corrective actions to normalize the process in cooperation with the shift supervisor and more experienced process workers. Participating under expert supervision in the preventive inspection of equipment, visual observations. Participating under expert supervision in performing maintenance work during repairs, shutdowns of the plant, and normal operation of the plant. Participation in preventive maintenance as needed. Implementing the Company’s integrated management system measures. Applying HSE and EHS rules. Maintaining cleanliness at the workplace, cleaning the plant. Other tasks as ordered by the direct supervisor, according to the needs of the job, qualifications, and personal working abilities. Condition: secondary vocational school - exclusively in mechanical, electrical engineering or chemical technology fields. Advantage - four-year school and work experience in the field. Required candidate profile: expressed organizational skills, willingness to work in a team and flexibility, responsibility and reliability. We offer: indefinite employment contract with a 6-month probation period, reimbursement of transportation costs to and from work, meal allowances, occasional bonuses (holiday pay, Christmas bonus) according to the provisions of the Collective Agreement, opportunity to work on diverse and interesting tasks in a dynamic work environment, opportunities for learning on the job and beyond. If you recognize the aforementioned job position as a challenge for your career and meet the given conditions, apply to the email address: karijera@petrokemija.hr by January 30, 2026, at the latest. Only timely and complete applications (CV and proof of meeting conditions) submitted to the stated email address will be considered, and applications from candidates who meet the requested conditions. In the application, be sure to indicate the position for which you are applying. Learn more about us at www.petrokemija.hr.

job_title: HEAD OF DEPARTMENT OF RENEWABLE ENERGY SOURCES
full_description: Responsibilities: Managing operations of the department with a focus on solar power projects ≥ 500 kW and energy storage system projects. Development, implementation, and development of growth, profitability, and market positioning strategies for the department. Independent management and coordination of projects, including planning, supervision, technical compliance, and communication with investors. Cooperation with other departments for timely and cost-effective procurement of equipment and materials. Participation in the preparation of price offers, cost estimates, and project budgets. Managing resources, costs, and profitability of projects and reporting to the Management of the Company. Leading, developing, and mentoring team members, and directing them towards responsible and quality execution of tasks. Performing other tasks related to the nature of the job. Necessary knowledge and competencies: Proven experience in designing, managing, or technical supervision of solar power plants with a minimum capacity of 500 kW and higher. Experience with energy storage system projects (BESS). Understanding technical specifications and technologies (inverters, transformers, SCADA, protection, battery systems). Experience working with multiple stakeholders: investors, contractors, designers, supervision, regulatory bodies. Knowledge in resource allocation, budgeting, timeline planning, and project documentation. Proven skills in leading people, task distribution, and technical mentoring. Willingness to take responsibility for the results of the department and compliance with the company’s business goals. Excellent knowledge of the English language in speech and writing is mandatory. Excellent communication skills and ability to clearly present technical and commercial information. Preference is given to candidates who have: Experience working on C&I projects (>500 kW) and/or industrial energy systems, Experience in public or commercial investment projects, Knowledge of Croatian regulatory procedures for connection and construction of solar power plants, Holding a license as an electrical engineer. What we offer: A key role in the development and management of energy projects with a capacity of ≥ 500 kW and energy storage systems. A high degree of autonomy in making technical and organizational decisions. The opportunity to build and shape your own team. Direct cooperation with Management and a clear decision-making structure. A long-term stable work environment and strategic direction focused on the development of the C&I and BESS segment. Possibility of additional training and certifications relevant to the development of the department.

We are an international corporation operating in almost 50 countries on 5 continents, and in Croatia, we are one of the companies in the field of construction and maintenance of roads and traffic infrastructure. full_description: CONDITIONS: Unqualified. Along with the application/request, candidates must submit: Resume, Citizenship certificate, diploma (depending on completed school) Proof of work experience (certificate from the competent HZMO service or a copy of the work book) Obligation to provide proof regarding criminal proceedings. A person who directly provides health care in the health system or participates in diagnostic and therapeutic procedures cannot be employed if criminal proceedings have been initiated against them or if they have been convicted of any of the criminal offenses from Chapter XVI of the Criminal Code (‘Narodne novine’, no. 125/11, 144/12, 56/15, 61/15 – correction, 101/17, 118/18, 126/19, 84/21, 114/22, 114/23, and 36/24.) – Criminal offenses against sexual freedom and Chapter XVII of the same Law – Criminal offenses of sexual abuse and exploitation of children. The hospital will obtain proof that the person from the previous paragraph has not been convicted of the criminal offenses mentioned above ex officio, and the candidate is obliged to provide proof that there are no proceedings against them for any of the criminal offenses from Chapter XVI of the Criminal Code (‘Narodne novine’, no. 125/11, 144/12, 56/15, 61/15 – correction, 101/17, 118/18, 126/19, 84/21, 114/22, 114/23, and 36/24.) – Criminal offenses against sexual freedom and Chapter XVII of the same Law – Criminal offenses of sexual abuse and exploitation of children. Priority in employment is given to persons from Article 102, paragraph 1 – 3 of the Law on Croatian veterans from the homeland war and their family members (NN 121/17, 98/19, 84/21, 156/23), to provide evidence from Article 103, paragraph 1 of the Law, for the purpose of obtaining priority employment rights. The Ministry of Croatian Veterans' website lists the required documents for priority employment rights according to Article 102, paragraph 1 through 3 of the Law on Croatian veterans from the homeland war and their family members, https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843. A candidate claiming the right to priority in employment according to Article 9 of the Law on professional rehabilitation and employment of persons with disabilities (NN 157/13, 152/14, 39/18, 32/20) must submit, along with the application for the competition, proof of disability status. A candidate exercising the right to priority in employment must invoke this right in their application. Announcement of the Competition, deadline for offers and announcement of the selection results The competition is published on the Employment Service website for a duration of 8 days, with the first day counted as the day following the announcement. Written applications are to be sent to: General hospital Zabok and Veterans’ hospital, Bračak 8, 49 210 Zabok. The results of the candidate selection will be published on the website of the General hospital Zabok and the Veterans hospital. Other notes Required documents may be submitted in copies, and selected candidates will present originals for inspection. Before the decision is made regarding the selection of candidates who meet the formal requirements, interviews may be conducted with candidates to get to know them and obtain general information about their previous work experience, interests, etc. By submitting an application for the competition, applicants consent to the processing of personal data for employment purposes, in accordance with the provisions of the General Regulation EU 2016/679. Terms used in this text, which are gender-specific, encompass both male and female genders equally. DIRECTOR Andreja Filija, MD, specialist, subspecialist.

full_description: Center for providing community services Zemunik URBROJ: 01-964/25 Zemunik Donji, 08. 12. 2025. Based on Article 24 of the Statute of the Center for providing community services Zemunik, Article 16 of the Collective Agreement for social welfare services (NN 61/18, 3/19, 60/22), and Article 23 of the Regulations on criteria for providing social services (NN 110/2022), and the obtained approvals from the Ministry of Labor, Pension System, Family and Social Policy KLASA: 100-01/25-02/646; URBROJ: 524-08-01-02/5-25-2, KLASA: 100-01/25-02/533; URBROJ: 524-08-01-02/5-25-2, KLASA: 100-001/25-02/651; URBROJ: 524-08-01-02/5-25-2, KLASA: 100-01/25-02/632; URBROJ: 524-08-01-02/3-25-2, KLASA: 100-01/25-02/625; URBROJ: 524-08-01-02/3-25-2 from December 3, 2025. PUBLIC COMPETITION for establishing an employment relation for the following positions: 6. Auxiliary worker/auxiliary worker in a system with special working conditions Conditions: completed primary education and no obstacles as per Article 261 of the Social Welfare Act. JOB DESCRIPTION: takes care of the arrangement and cleaning of the Center's space, takes care of the plantations, orchard, vegetable garden, olive grove, complete environment and economy, takes care of animals, maintains the surroundings, performs technical tasks in the client's house, carries out repairs in the Center as needed, complies with all occupational health and fire protection measures, and performs other tasks as instructed by the manager and director that are related to their work. Responsible for their work to the manager and director. The application must include the personal information of the applicant: name and surname, address, phone number/cell phone, email address. The application must be signed. Along with the written application, candidates are required to attach: resume proof of appropriate educational qualifications copy of citizenship certificate for pension insurance evidence of recorded work experience (electronic printout) certification that no criminal proceedings are being conducted against the candidate (not older than 30 days) for positions 1 and 5 - proof of a passed driving test category B for positions 1, 3, 4, and 5 - proof of work experience in relevant jobs (copy of the employment contract, decision, confirmation, etc.) for position 3 - proof of completed nursing course for position 5 - proof of completed training for operating and handling boilers. Submitted documentation is delivered in copy in Croatian, with the obligation for the selected candidate to provide the original or certified copy after selection. A complete application is considered one that contains all data and attachments specified in the competition. A person who has not submitted a timely or complete application or does not meet the formal requirements of the competition will not be considered a candidate in the competition process, and their application will not be reviewed. Submitted documentation will not be returned. Persons who, according to special regulations, have the right to priority in employment must refer to this right in their application, i.e., attach all prescribed documentation according to a special law, and they have priority over other candidates only under equal conditions. A candidate invoking priority in employment in accordance with Article 102 of the Law on Croatian veterans from the Homeland War and their family members (NN no. 121/17, 98/19, 84/21, 156/23), in addition to proof of meeting the required conditions, must attach the evidence prescribed by Article 102, paragraph 1, according to the conditions of Article 103 of the Law on Croatian veterans from the Homeland War and their family members, which are published on the Ministry of Croatian Veterans website: https://branitelji.gov.hr/zaposljavanje-843/843 (https://branitelji.gov.hr/UserDocsImages/ING/12%20Prosinac/Zapošljavanje//Popis%20Dokaza%20za%20ostvarivanje%20prava%20prednosti%20pri%20zapošljavanja.pdf). Candidates who exercise priority in employment according to Article 48 of the Law on civilian victims of the Homeland War (NN no. 84/21) must submit evidence from Article 49, paragraph 1 of the mentioned Law for the purpose of achieving the right to priority in employment. The Center for providing community services Zemunik will use and process the collected personal data of candidates solely for the purpose of conducting the public recruitment process, in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU 2016/679.) and the Law on Violations of the General Data Protection Regulation (NN 42/18.), and shall keep it for the legally prescribed duration. Interviews will be conducted with all candidates. By submitting the application, the candidate is considered to have given consent to the processing of personal data for employment purposes, according to the provisions of the General Regulation on Personal Data Protection. Both sexes can apply equally for the competition. Applications with proof of meeting the competition conditions can be submitted in person or sent by mail to: Center for Providing Community Services, Zemunik, Street I, number 53, 23 222 Zemunik Donji, marked: 'Application for Employment for Position 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6'. The deadline for submission is 8 days from the date of publication of the competition in the Narodne novine. The Center reserves the right to cancel the competition or not to select any candidate, without the obligation to justify its decision and without any responsibility towards the candidates.

Our mission is the planning, manufacturing, delivery, assembly, and commissioning of steam turbine sets, fully meeting the individual customer needs. We combine top quality with effective and safe processes, constantly questioning our thinking and actions in terms of sustainability regarding our products, the environment, and the health and development of our employees. As an employer, we are a professionally operating medium-sized company (currently about 170 employees) that has retained the flexibility and responsiveness from its founding days through short decision-making processes and flat hierarchies. In this spirit, we think solution-oriented and pragmatically, are bold and decisive, and can thus respond quickly and purposefully in the interest of customers and employees. As we are continuously growing, we are looking for reinforcement immediately as a Pipe Fitter/Pipe Mechanic (m/f/d). This is how you fit in with us: - You take responsibility for your actions towards our customers and colleagues. - You enjoy working in a team, as you like to be connected and think beyond your area. - You value honest and direct communication, but also respectful and appreciative communication. - You appreciate it when a company not only expects loyalty from you but also invests in its employees. - You are authentic and integral, living your own values and beliefs while bringing your unique traits. - You enjoy dealing with international customers, are willing to travel, and can express yourself well in German and English - perhaps you even speak another foreign language. **** You are responsible for: - You take over the preparatory work for the piping during the assembly of our steam turbine sets. What we expect from you: - Completed training as a pipe mechanic or in the field of metal construction, welding technology, or comparable qualification. - Relevant professional experience in pipeline construction. - High willingness to travel and flexibility (80% field service). - Confident handling of usual welding documents, independent work according to planning documents/isometries. - Class B driver's license. - Technical understanding. What we offer you: - 30 days of vacation/year - Flexibility for working off overtime - Employee offers through the Corporate Benefit Program - Bicycle leasing as a non-cash benefit - Contribution to company pension plan or VWL - Employer-financed accident insurance (also for private accidents). You can apply directly through the application form on our website: https://www.tgmkanis.com/karriere (https://www.tgmkanis.com/karriere) TGM Kanis Turbinen GmbH Am Flachmoor 6 90475 Nuremberg Team Human Resources.

ACG Europe d.o.o. is one of the leading manufacturers of hard gelatin capsules in Europe. It is located in Ludbreg and is part of an international organization headquartered in India. More information can be found at www.acg-world.com. We are currently looking for a Worker for the position of Technician in Gelatin Preparation (m/f). Job description: Preparation of dye solution for coloring gelatin solution according to working instructions; Preparation of dispersing fillers for colored gelatin solutions according to working instructions; Coloring of gelatin solution and viscosity, shade, and temperature corrections (if necessary) according to working instructions; Shade and temperature corrections; Checking parameters of dyed gelatin solution according to working instructions; Checking the correctness of tank valves and presence of air bubbles and black spots in the prepared dyed gelatin solution; Responsibility for maintaining the cleanliness of the gelatin preparation area; Washing and disinfection of dishes and equipment for preparing components for gelatin solution coloring and preparation of gelatin solution; Timely and orderly keeping of prescribed documentation in accordance with applicable working instructions and good documentation practices; Data entry into information system (SAP); Preparation of titanium dioxide dispersion in the Temec reactor; Adherence to GMP and ISO system regulations and procedures; Making the weighings of dyes, fillers, and additives according to the production plan; Calibration of scales according to working instructions. Required competencies: Formal education: High school diploma in chemistry or pharmaceutical orientation; Experience: preferably 1 year in similar jobs, not mandatory; Foreign language: Basic knowledge of English language in speaking and writing; Computer knowledge: Knowledge of MS Office suite. WHY ACG EUROPE? Work in the pharmaceutical industry; Structured introduction to work with a mentor; Continuous professional training and development; Professionally challenging job in an international environment; Competitive financial package: rewards for achieved business results (monthly and annual); Travel expenses fully paid; Occasional rewards (Easter bonuses, vacation bonuses, Christmas bonuses, gifts for children, support for newborns); Meal allowance; Additional benefits: health check-up, gym usage, occasional gifts, free coffee.

JOB DESCRIPTION: BIO-MI d.o.o. is a company specialized in research, development, and production of biodegradable and compostable polymers. We are looking for a technically oriented person who will be an important link between the production and R&D team. Working and supervising process equipment (extrusion lines, mixers, granulation systems, etc.); Process optimization and monitoring production parameters; Participation in testing and introduction of new formulations into production; Laboratory testing; Working on EU projects which includes attending meetings across Europe; Managing technical documentation and proposing process improvements. REQUIREMENTS: Mandatory university degree or higher vocational education in technical fields - chemical engineering, process engineering, mechanical engineering, and related professions; Understanding of the operation of process and production equipment; Independence in technical work and problem-solving; Organization, precision, and a tendency towards teamwork; Active knowledge of the English language in speech and writing; Computer skills; Driving license: category B. Desirable experience in working on process equipment (extrusion, mixing, drying, etc.); Knowledge of polymer, plastic, or similar material industrial production; Experience in technical maintenance and process optimization.

For our location in Vrhovljan, we are seeking a motivated and entrepreneurial leader to take operational and strategic responsibility and lead the location into the next phase of growth. Your mission is to take full responsibility for operational efficiency, financial results, and organizational development of the location. You will be the key contact for internal and external stakeholders and play an important role in implementing larger projects. Your responsibilities Operational and financial leadership: Ensure operational excellence and take full responsibility for the financial results of the location. Manage budgeting, cost control, and forecasting. Report timely and accurately on performance, achievements, and deviations. Initiate corrective measures in case of deviations from budget or planned results. Leadership skills and organizational development: Lead, develop, and support the team at the location. Encourage continuous improvement and a positive, high-performance work culture. Ability to work effectively with a team that is predominantly female. Project management: Lead and implement larger projects at the location (e.g., facility expansion, SAP system integration). Define and plan necessary resources according to the budget and project scope. Cross-functional collaboration and stakeholder relations: Be the key contact person for Interface d.o.o. (Klema Austria / GC). Responsible for finance, procurement, reporting, and budgeting processes. Manage and resolve customer complaints. Safety, quality, and infrastructure: Perform the role of EHS coordinator at the location. Ensure safe, compliant, and efficient daily operations. Oversee maintenance and infrastructure processes. Your profile Experience in the medical or other strictly regulated industry Strong entrepreneurial mindset Very good knowledge of the English language Solid knowledge of SAP Excellent leadership and communication skills Ability to lead effectively and collaborate in a team with a predominantly female workforce High organization, structuring, and problem-solving orientation Passion for maintaining oversight of processes and achieving results Willingness to travel occasionally What we offer A role with responsibilities from day one An opportunity to actively shape and develop the location A dynamic, international working environment Space for professional and personal development An attractive compensation package Interested? If you are ready to make an impact and lead the future of our location in Vrhovljan, we look forward to your application at the email: klema.croatia@klema.at

job_title: OPERATOR OF RAW MATERIAL SORTING MACHINE
full_description: Manually inspects raw materials and separates waste, foreign bodies, damaged or unusable pieces. Works to ensure that only clean, quality, and indisputable raw materials proceed to the process. Recognizes types of waste (damaged, dirty, overcooked/underprocessed, contaminated). Sorts materials according to a pre-defined quality standard. Timely cleaning and emptying of sieves, trays, or conveyors. Reporting irregularities on the equipment (poor motor performance, blockage, wear).

The company AK BAU-project d.o.o. is looking for a person to perform the work of a bricklayer/site manager in the city of Zagreb. The employer is looking for a person with experience. Duties: bricklaying work, supervising a team of bricklayers, task distribution and maintaining order on the construction site. Net salary 2000.00 EUR.

With active mentoring from engineers with many years of experience, and in collaboration with the rest of the engineering team, the employer describes the job responsibilities with which the intern starts their career as a civil engineer: • Managing the construction diary and construction log • Coordinating site activities • Performing work with subcontractors and controlling them (deadlines, quality, costs) • Organizational, financial, and time tracking of the project • Preparing feasibility studies • Developing execution solutions and detailed drawings of the execution details. The employer offers: The opportunity for the candidate to become acquainted with a wide range of jobs and activities that are part of the career of a construction engineer in a relatively short period, and further, within the team, you can profile yourself long-term for jobs that suit you better and where you can use all your potential. • Incentivizing work atmosphere • Opportunities for personal and professional development • Encouraging remuneration • Possibility of bonuses according to achieved results • Additional professional training (seminars at the construction chamber, supplier and manufacturer seminars) • Occasional payments and financial support • Your qualifications: • Civil engineer (Associate/Bachelor's degree) • Reliability and responsibility in work and assigned tasks • Use of Office packages (Excel, Project) and AutoCAD program. APPLICATION -> to info info@mig-zagreb.hr, and interviews with candidates will be held at agreed times in our office in Zagreb or via video call.

TASKS: independent management of works and project analysis, preparation of organizational and scheduling plans of the project as well as contracting plans, ordering materials and other resources, forming, managing, and coordinating teams and supervising and controlling the execution of works, participating in the establishment of the construction site and ensuring all conditions for the start of work, managing all necessary construction documentation (construction diary, construction log, collecting certifications, etc.) from the introduction to the job to the technical inspection (compliance of construction with the contractual documentation and provisions of the contract), delivering and preparing reports on completed parts of works and their costs, monitoring financial results of the construction site, participation in the execution of works on the site in terms of quality, quantity, deadlines, and costs, participation in the organization and coordination of works on the site in accordance with the project and contract, participating in contracting works with subcontractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders in construction and controlling implementation, coordination with the construction team, controlling the execution of works, managing the construction diary and preparing the construction log, participating in coordination meetings with the investor, supervising engineer, subcontractors, and suppliers. QUALIFICATIONS: secondary vocational education in construction technology, knowledge of English language in speaking and writing, work experience (preferred but not required), good knowledge and implementation of safety measures, willingness to travel and work in the field, reliability, responsibility, and commitment to work tasks, organizational skills, negotiating skills, developed social skills, and communication skills, independence in work, active knowledge of working in AutoCad and MS Project.

We are the e-recruiting professionals! Maxime HR Ltd. offers companies a professional and unique software solution for modern e-recruiting. We support medium-sized companies as well as corporations with the cloud-based Maxime HR software, from job posting to hiring, and offer competent support in all recruitment processes. Become part of our success story! We are looking for now or by appointment: SOFTWARE DEVELOPERS YOUR TASKS WILL INCLUDE: * Development and maintenance of web-based software solutions (front-end and / or back-end) * Continuous modernization of our software, processes and modules * Development of new technical ideas and concepts around the topic of e-recruiting * Analyze and optimize the current applications YOU HAVE: * A successfully completed computer science degree or a comparable training / professional experience * Experience in developing and programming web-based applications * Excellent knowledge of HTML, CSS, PHP, Javascript etc. * Knowledge of complex data structures (XML, JSON) and relational databases (MySQL) * Symfony, Composer, Git are terms you are familiar with WE OFFER: * An exciting task in a modern work environment * Very good development opportunities, flat organization and scope to contribute your own ideas * An attractive salary with numerous benefits and bonuses * Modern working time models such as 4 days a week and home office solutions INTERESTED? Then we look forward to your detailed application documents stating your expected salary. We are happy to answer any questions at +357 99962979. More information about our company: www.maxime-hr.com [http://www.maxime-hr.com]. Maxime HR Ltd. Maintenance and repair of production equipment Tasks: - Monitoring the technical condition of factory production equipment and infrastructure. - Maintenance and troubleshooting of milling, turning, grinding, EDM, and other production equipment. - Equipment diagnostics, fault analysis, and on-site repair when possible. - Communication with external maintenance partners, including ordering repair teams and coordinating work. - Documentation of equipment maintenance and repairs as per requirements. - Proposing improvements to enhance equipment reliability and production efficiency. - Technical support during production processes if needed. We offer: - A stable job in a developing and modern manufacturing company. - A well-equipped and orderly working environment where equipment is regularly maintained. - Necessary tools and management support in daily tasks. - Opportunity to work independently and directly influence the factory's technical condition and reliability. - A professional team that values good ideas and practical solutions. - Competitive salary based on experience and contribution. - Continuous workload and long-term employment relationship in a stable company. Other requirements: Accuracy, responsibility, independent troubleshooting skills, and willingness to take responsibility. Remote working possibility: No.

Job responsibilities: Designing and developing electronic systems. We offer: Stable work in a reliable and growing company. Friendly team and supportive work environment. Documentation according to labor laws. Career opportunities. Training if necessary. Work from home option: No

We offer: o Varied and interesting daily work. o A friendly working environment and a professional team. o Additional training if needed. o Opportunity for career and personal development. o Stable income based on work done. o Opportunity to work in a modern production factory. o Possibility to start working immediately. o Opportunity for internal development in the company. Other requirements: Expectations: o Good technical understanding and drawing-reading skills. o Good negotiation skills. o Good planning and organizational ability. o Knowledge of plate material furniture technology. o Ability to work independently. o Precision, consistency, and systematic approach. o Good level of Estonian and English in both spoken and written form. Work from home option: No

Job responsibilities: We are looking for a design engineer for our team, whose duties include: - developing dies and other instruments for various machine tools; - proficiency in 3D modeling programs (SolidWorks or Catia); - preparing technical documentation; - designing and implementing new products into production. We offer: Diverse and varied work. We are willing to train recently graduated engineers. We are also ready to offer work to Ukrainian war refugees. Other requirements: Candidate expectations: - technical higher education; - proficiency in 3D modeling programs (SolidWorks or Catia); - work experience in product design is an advantage. Work from home option: No

Job responsibilities: Using SolidWorks program, calculating and designing mechanical engineering solutions. 3-D modeling and drawing using SolidWorks, preparing construction budgets and controlling their implementation. Certificate IWT/IWE is an advantage. We offer: Stable work. Other requirements: Technical higher education; proficiency in using SolidWorks. Work from home option: No

For the CNC turning department of a company operating in Peetri, we are looking for a technologist. Job responsibilities: The main objective of the technologist's job is to determine the optimal technology for preparing price quotes; CNC programming; ordering and maintaining tools; developing production technology and continuously improving and supporting the production process. 1. Describing the technological part of price quotes: Determining the technology for products to prepare price quotes; evaluating the production process and time costs to provide realistic and competitive quotes; ensuring planned vs. reported working time is equal or more efficient. Information Monitor ERP (e-factor). 2. Programming: Creating programs for CNC machines, selecting optimal tools according to drawings and requirements; testing and optimizing programs as needed to ensure work efficiency and quality. 3. Ordering tools and equipment: Identifying and ordering necessary tools and equipment for the job. Ensuring the availability of necessary measuring devices in cooperation with the quality department; monitoring tool quality and recommending new solutions if necessary; monitoring tool usage within the Toolboss system related to your unit. 4. Developing production technology: Developing new technologies and methods to increase production efficiency; staying up-to-date with the latest technology, equipment, and tool developments; participating in international fairs and keeping up with new technologies through communication with equipment and tool manufacturers. 5. Improving and optimizing production processes: Supporting setup and operators; guiding and assisting setup and operators to ensure smooth production processes; conducting internal training when possible and continuously sharing information with setups and operators; finding suitable external training for the team when possible; solving work-based problems and providing technical support; being responsible for employee training. We offer: As a team member, you will get: Good working conditions and tools in a modern production company in Peetri; diverse work and a supportive team; to participate in exciting team events, work anniversaries, and training sessions; many different benefits (marriage support, newborn support, funeral benefit, glasses compensation, support for children starting first grade, and much more). Other requirements: We expect from you: Technical aptitude; higher and/or professional vocational education; knowledge of control systems (Fanuc, Siemens, Haas, Maztrol, etc., must be familiar with at least one); high-level proficiency in Estonian and English, knowledge of Russian is an advantage; previous experience as a technologist for metalworking machines is beneficial, preferably 2-5 years; proficiency in using programs (Master CAM, Sinumerik, Mazatrol, G-code, etc.); strong expression and communication skills. Work from home option: No

Indoor Climate Measurement Technician Job Responsibilities: The candidate is expected to participate in the following activities: - Measuring and adjusting ventilation systems according to applicable standards (air flows, pressures, temperatures); - Conducting pressure tests for duct tightness and measuring air leakage; - Measuring noise levels at technical systems in both indoor and outdoor environments; - Comparative and balancing work of heating and cooling systems; - Documenting measurement results at the site and composing protocols; - Participating in reading project drawings and creating measurement plans if needed; - Communicating with clients and other project team members and coordinating measurement work at the site; - Ensuring the quality of measurement and adjustment work and fulfilling the company's occupational safety and quality requirements. We offer: - Competitive salary (fixed + performance-based additional benefits); - On-the-job training and further education; - Work equipment and measuring instruments; - Company vehicle for work tasks; - Opportunity to participate in interesting projects across Estonia (or in an agreed area); - Supportive and professional team. Other requirements: - At least vocational education, technical or construction field preferred, - Good technical understanding and analytical thinking, - B-category driving license, - Ability to read and understand project drawings, - Computer skills (Office, measurement software, AutoCAD), - Good physical fitness and willingness to move between sites, - Responsibility and accuracy in documentation, - Previous experience in ventilation, HVAC, or construction fields is a significant advantage. 2. C++ Software Developer for EDA Software Job responsibilities: This is a position for a C++ developer who contributes directly to the KiCad codebase. Open-source work differs from traditional industrial roles: your contributions are public, you communicate directly with end users, and you work closely with a distributed development team. There is plenty of work—KiCad has many actively developed areas, and you have the opportunity to focus on those features and subsystems that interest you the most. As we work completely remotely, we rely on continuous communication. You should be ready to be actively in touch with the team through our internal communication channels during working hours. Job duties: - Development and maintenance of the KiCad C++ codebase. - Documenting your work. - Fixing bugs—both your own and inherited bugs. - Working directly with users to diagnose and solve problems. - Guiding new co-authors. - Participating in 1–2 international conferences per year to present your work. We offer: Development opportunities: Depending on your interests, you can expand into community communication and public speaking, conducting training sessions, project management, or business development. We support professional development through courses, training, or other education. Perks: - Remote work opportunities. - Flexible working hours. - Professional development support. Other requirements: Requirements: - Significant history of public C++ projects (commits). - Proven communication skills with users (through bug reports, forums, presentations, etc.). - Commitment to open-source principles and collaborative development. - Knowledge in electronics and electrical engineering is a plus. Job Responsibilities: The day of a galvanizing line operator begins with preparation – they check and prepare all necessary tools and ensure that the equipment is in working order. If everything is in order, they start the galvanizing line according to the work instructions and monitor the course of the process to ensure that the details move in the correct order on the line and receive the necessary coating. At the end of processing, they visually and with measuring tools check the quality of the details. They also regularly participate in equipment maintenance to ensure the smooth operation of the line. On our part, we offer: - New knowledge and practical training - Real opportunities for advancement within the company - A friendly and supportive team where you will be genuinely noticed. 1. Welcome to SEARCH4 Global, a brand of S4G Talent Solutions GmbH! We combine state-of-the-art AI with 22+ years of recruiting expertise to match talent with leading companies fast, precisely, globally! Why this role matters Our client is a European pioneer in digital security and Switzerland's CIAM market leader. Nevis champions passwordless, user-friendly access for highly regulated industries such as finance, insurance and iGaming its technology secures 80%+ of Swiss online banking transactions. With headquarters in Zurich and offices across Europe, Nevis scales through a strong partner ecosystem. For Budapest (hybrid) we are hiring exclusively on behalf of our client: Security Support Engineer (IAM/Cloud) (M/F/D) As a Security Support Engineer (IAM/Cloud), you are the technical backbone between cutting-edge identity products and mission-critical customer environments. You own complex incidents, keep systems healthy, enable partners to help themselves, and turn insights into durable fixes and knowledge. Substance over show. Your Mission: - Own the support lifecycle: Work L2/L3/Consulting tickets end-to-end; meet or beat SLAs with clear, proactive comms. - Be a technical detective: Analyse integration logic and system flows; collect logs/configs/repro steps; build a complete picture before proposing solutions. - Resolve critical incidents: Diagnose, troubleshoot and fix complex issues; escalate to Product, Engineering (L3) or Consulting when needed never drop the baton. - Enable users & partners: Guide customers through docs and the Nevis Academy; answer questions and coach for self-sufficiency. - Capture knowledge: Document root causes, workarounds and runbooks; grow the internal knowledge base. - Streamline communication: Keep Zendesk Jira perfectly in sync; provide crisp, timely status to users and management. - Monitor & maintain: Respond to alerts in Azure; perform routine maintenance (updates/backups) on cloud & suite test environments (incl. new versions). - 24/7 readiness: Join the on-call rotation to provide critical coverage outside business hours. - Coordinate effectively: Triage feature/change requests, align with Product Management and schedule stakeholder meetings. What you bring: - Education: BSc/MSc in IT/CS or equivalent hands-on experience. - Experience: 2-4 years in a customer-facing engineering role (support/SRE/professional services). - Cloud & containers: Practical experience with Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift, and cloud (Azure or AWS). - Networking & security: Solid grasp of load balancers, WAF, DNS, HTTPS, SSL/TLS. - Data & CI: Basic SQL (e.g., MariaDB/Oracle/PostgreSQL); familiarity with GitHub Actions. - Soft skills: Exceptional English written & verbal skills; calm under pressure; proactive, service-centric, solution-oriented. - **Nice to have:** IAM standards (OAuth2/OIDC/SAML), federation, SSO, reverse proxies; Scripting/automation (Bash/Python), Helm/Terraform, observability (Prometheus/Grafana); ITIL practices (Incident/Problem/Change), runbook automation, post-mortems. Your Benefits: - Company performance-related bonus. - Flexible & hybrid working model. - Strong healthcare coverage. - Learning & development programs; certification support. - Parental support. - Ample PTO & holidays. - 24/7 Employee Assistance Program (EAP). - Country-specific benefits per local regulations. Next steps Sounds like you? Apply with your CV plus 2-3 short bullets on your most relevant achievements (e.g., **MTTR** by x%, SLA compliance >95% across L2/L3, automated Azure/K8s monitoring & alerting, successful IAM integration triage with durable KB/runbooks). We'll get back to you quickly and look forward to meeting you! Please note that (m/f/d) is gender-inclusive and welcomes all genders. Apply now to become part of a fantastic, intercultural success story. We actively support equal opportunity and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and abilities. All genders, every origin, any age and life path. Experienced candidates (incl. 45+/50+) are explicitly encouraged to apply. Applications to: bewerbung@searchfour.de (https://mailto: bewerbung@searchfour.de ) SEARCH4 Global S4G Talent Solutions GmbH Hauptstraße 44 40789 Monheim am Rhein www.searchfour.de ( http://www.searchfour.de /)

THE LATVIAN BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH AND STUDY CENTER registration No. 90002120158 announces a competition for the vacant position of Research Group Leader - One Health Environmental Informatics. The Latvian Biomedicine Research and Study Center (BMC) invites applications for the position of Research Group Leader at the One Health Informatics Center (OHIC), which will be established under the ERA Chair project EchoHEALTH. The objective of this project is to create a new research unit to lead the integration and analysis of environmental, health, and omics data to improve public health understanding. Special attention is given to environmental metagenomics, microbial genomics, and advanced bioinformatics. This is a unique opportunity to start a new direction at a leading research institute and establish oneself as a leading researcher. We are looking for a talented scientist with a strong research vision and the ability to create and lead a competitive research group. The ideal candidate must be able to work interdisciplinary and have a research profile that aligns with the goals of the EchoHEALTH project. Key research directions Expected from the selected group leader is the development of a research program in one or more of the following areas: Environmental metagenomics focused on microbial community structure, bacterial genome plasticity, and antimicrobial resistance.

The Latvian Biomedical Research and Study Center (BMC) invites applications for a full-time researcher position in the Molecular Plant-Microorganism Interaction research group within the project ‘Integration of novel plant growth-promoting bacteria (PGPB) and mycorrhizal fungi to enhance crop yield and develop innovative microbiological biopreparations (PGPB-MYCOFORM)’ under the PostDoc Latvia program. Duties include isolating new soil PGPB and testing their properties, studying previously identified PGPB and mycorrhiza synergies in increasing plant biomass and pathogen resistance, investigating plant molecular responses to PGPB, describing the impact of new PGPB and mycorrhizal formulations on crop stress resistance, growth, and physiology. company_name: Institute of Solid State Physics, University of Latvia
full_description: The Institute of Solid State Physics at the University of Latvia (LU CFI) invites you to join the team as a Research Support Expert. The project "Smart Windows for Zero Energy Buildings" (SWEB) aims to develop world-renowned and excellent research on functional materials and their SWEB applications, improve educational capacity, and promote changes in institutional governance to achieve excellence and sustainability. The Institute of Solid State Physics at the University of Latvia (LU CFI) is the research leader in functional materials and coatings in Latvia. The institute dedicates significant resources to material research, testing, advanced training, and innovation. LU CFI's main technologies are based on the deposition of inorganic and organic thin films on various materials and surfaces using different advanced deposition methods, employing existing technologies and developing new ones. Thin-film technologies are managed by highly qualified personnel, allowing the deposition of new materials according to scientific research projects and industrial clients. Main job duties: 1. Participate in the development of international collaboration projects, prepare technical applications.

DRIVEN BY PERFORMANCE? We are looking for motivated team players who want to help us drive the success of our company even further. We combine the experience of an internationally operating enterprise with the spirit and agility of an innovative start-up. Development and logistics are your passion? You enjoy working with ABAP and love continuously improving your skills? Then bring your enthusiasm and join us – fully remote from anywhere in Europe or at one of our office locations. Sounds exciting? Take the next step and send us your application! Become part of our team and actively shape the future of logistics with us! YOUR PLACE IN SUCCESS • You will develop modern UI5 dialogs in the backend • The integration of material flow systems into SAP EWM is part of your responsibilities • Connecting automation technology and processes in the warehouse and logistics environment is also part of your role • You implement BADIs to flexibly adapt and extend SAP standard functions • You actively support the team during migrations and system changes • Technical error analysis and debugging are part of your daily work • You carefully document your developments and processes • In addition, you implement interfaces to third-party systems (SAP and non-SAP systems) WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR • You have at least 3 years of professional experience in this field • You have strong ABAP programming skills, including ABAP OO • Ideally, you have knowledge of the SAP EWM module • Experience in logistics-related projects is a plus • You show a strong willingness to learn and are eager to continuously develop your technical skills • Clear and effective communication within the team and with project stakeholders comes naturally to you • You speak English fluently, ideally • Knowledge of German is a plus • You have completed vocational training in computer science with a focus on application development or hold a related degree. Benefits • A fair salary – overtime is flexibly compensated with either time off or financial reward • A hybrid work model with flexible hours and the option to work fully from home • Full control over your annual leave (30–90 days) and exciting workation opportunities • Pleasant business trips that are enjoyable, not stressful • Comprehensive onboarding and enablement: introduction days, a buddy system, and structured onboarding plans ensure you succeed from day one • Learning and development that truly advances your career: access a wide range of professional and personal seminars through our SWAN Academy • Clear career perspectives with regular feedback and development discussions to support your growth • Approachable leadership, a transparent corporate culture, and plenty of company events – from summer and Christmas parties to site events, team activities, breakfast talks, and one-on-one sessions with management. Salary At SWAN, we place great value on fair and appropriate compensation for our employees. We understand that each individual brings unique qualifications and experiences that are valuable to our company. That’s why our salary offers are based on a careful assessment of your education, professional experience, as well as your personal and family circumstances. We strive to create an environment where our employees feel valued and recognized—not only through our corporate culture but also through our compensation policy. During the interview, we will discuss career paths and salary bands with you, and work together to determine an individualized placement that reflects your skills and experience within our compensation structure. Get in Touch Apply directly through our online career portal: www.swan.de/karriere or send your complete application documents via email to: karriere@swan.de. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us. Montae Clarke E-Mail: karriere@swan.de We look forward to hearing from you! About us SWAN - we live performance As a modern company, SWAN GmbH stands for the digital transformation in SAP logistics. At its locations in Augsburg, Altenstadt an der Waldnaab, Dortmund, Giebelstadt, Graz, Nuremberg, Wächtersbach and Walldorf, SWAN experts implement manual and automated logistics solutions based on the SAP modules SAP EWM and SAP TM. The focus is on innovative SAP logistics solutions, control of automated systems, technical interfaces as well as service and support. In addition, SWAN offers many add-ons in the areas of material flow, direct coupling and IoT connection, Real Time Location System (RTLS) and SAPUI5 usability at all workstations. The customer base includes companies from medium-sized businesses as well as international corporations. Successfully implemented projects from the food & beverage, automotive, chemical, pharmaceutical, retail, high-tech and electronics sectors are testimony to SWAN's expertise, both in the environment of highly automated distribution warehouses and in production integration and transport scheduling. Uncomplicated and flexible, SWAN founded 10 years ago, provides its more than 120 employees with an optimal working environment for experts and promotes self-responsible work according to the agile "New-Way-of-Working" principle. It lives openness, is characterized by flat hierarchies, stands for team spirit, cohesion and innovative spirit. Short decision-making processes, flexible work arrangements and a balanced degree of personal responsibility, coupled with open communication and creative cooperation - these are important ingredients in SWAN GmbH's recipe for success.

Do you like to use your digital expertise to improve efficiency and employee experience? Join Vestas as a ServiceNow Solution Designer and shape scalable solutions that support our global workforce and our mission for renewable energy. Digital Solutions & Development > Digital Solutions > Service Management The demand for the Enterprise Service Management product team in Digital Solutions is growing, and the team of professional, passionate, and competent colleagues in the Philippines and Denmark needs you. The team designs, develops, and delivers Enterprise Service Management solutions used by all over 30,000 Vestas employees. The solutions cover numerous business areas within the company and enable efficient orchestration and workflows across the ServiceNow platform technology. The design of all solutions focuses on the needs of the people who use them, as well as on Vestas' strategic goals and priorities. Responsibilities In this position, you will take on a selection or combination of: - Designing and delivering end-to-end solutions on the ServiceNow platform to optimize efficiency and employee experience, streamline business processes, and ensure seamless system integration - Collaborating with stakeholders to create visually intuitive and user-friendly solutions that minimize cognitive load and align with business goals, operationalized through engagement to capture practices and requirements, translating them into features, user stories, and technical tasks - Managing multiple projects and stakeholders with differing backgrounds, roles, and skills while supporting design, development, testing, and deployment of Service Management solutions on the ServiceNow platform - Contributing to establishing best practices and governance for development and configuration on the ServiceNow platform, avoiding technical debt, ensuring a scalable and healthy platform, and innovating with low-code/no-code solutions - Co-designing strategies for delivering Enterprise Service Management solutions - Creating training content and promoting adoption to achieve business value at Vestas - Working in an agile and collaborative development environment, enabled by transparency and active participation in Scrum practices Qualifications - Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or a related field with over 2 years of experience in Service Management on the ServiceNow platform - Practical experience with at least three of the following: ITSM Pro, Integration Hub, HR Service Delivery Pro, Workplace Service Delivery, SecOps, App Engine, Employee Center, Next Experience, OTSM, or ServiceNow GenAI - Solid understanding of solution architecture, service management concepts, and platform lifecycle - Proven experience in conducting workshops and translating business requirements into solution designs - Competent in stakeholder communication and cross-functional collaboration - Experience in project coordination or agile delivery - Fluent in English with effective oral and written communication skills Skills As a person: - You have an interest in exploring business processes and practices to gain a deeper understanding of how systems operate in an organizational context and experience in designing user journeys - You are naturally professional and committed with a strong quality awareness and consider continuous service improvement and optimization in everything you do - You are flexible with a can-do attitude and an innovative mindset and thrive in an exciting environment with advanced people - You are self-motivated – you act autonomously. When you see issues in the implementation of a solution, you ensure that they are noted for future prioritization - You are familiar with agile working methods and actively contribute to a collaborative development environment - You value simplicity and clarity in your solutions, aiming to reduce complexity and deliver intuitive user experiences - You appreciate building relationships and closely collaborating with others to create mutual understanding and alignment What we offer Work in a dynamic and innovative environment where you can shape the future of digital collaboration and workplace solutions at Vestas. Career development opportunities with access to training and development programs. Be part of a collaborative culture that values teamwork and knowledge sharing and operates according to Vestas values: simplicity, collaboration, responsibility, and passion. Additional information The position can be based at our locations in Aarhus or Copenhagen (Denmark), Warsaw or Szczecin (Poland), Hamburg (Germany), Porto (Portugal), Manila (Philippines), or Chennai (India). Please note that this position does not offer relocation assistance. Therefore, we encourage applicants who already reside near one of the mentioned locations. We reserve the right to change or withdraw this job posting at any time, even before the application deadline. We recommend applying by 22.07.2025.

At Accelleron, you will move forward! Building on the success story of more than 100 years of ABB Turbocharging, you will be part of a team of true experts in an exciting international environment, committed to excellence. As a trusted partner, we support our customers in the transition to sustainable industries with innovative technology, expertise, and smart solutions. We promote diversity and inclusion in all dimensions (e.g. gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity, age, disability, religion, or other characteristics) as we embrace and celebrate individual differences. Do you enjoy implementing projects in a modern manufacturing environment? These involve improvement projects of medium complexity. You will be responsible for planning, implementing, and successfully completing the project. Do you have experience in Lean Management / Lean Six Sigma and the ability to convey this knowledge accordingly? Your profile complements with skills such as teamwork, analytical thinking & acting, high self-motivation or initiative, assertiveness, and a structured working style? Then you are the right fit for our team. Your tasks: Implementing medium complexity improvement projects Implementing digitization projects Participating in cross-divisional projects Conveying knowledge on Lean Management / Lean Six Sigma Applying common Lean tools such as 5S, KVP, PDCA, SMED, etc. Contact person in the division for parts marking Acquiring in-depth process knowledge E2E in the areas of serialization and parts marking along with the involved systems Independently improving, adjusting, and simplifying processes related to serialization Division representative in our warehousing transformation project (introduction of SAP EWM) Your requirements: Completed vocational training and further education at HF level, Bachelor's or Master's degree from university or university of applied sciences Experience in implementing medium-sized projects Experience in SAP EWM Proven project success in a digitization project Experience in an industrial environment Knowledge in the area of Lean Management / Lean Six Sigma Affinity for IT topics and data analysis Very good German language skills, both spoken and written, English skills are an advantage Logistics process expertise and experience with SAP EWM are advantages Very good communication and organizational skills Teamwork Enthusiasm Your benefits: Canteen Attractive vacation plans Employee assistance program Flexible working hours and models We look forward to your application (preferably in English).
