company_name: UMICORE BATTERY MATERIALS POLAND Limited Liability Company
full_description: Job description: As a laboratory technician, you will support the analytical operations of our facility's laboratory by carrying out measurements, maintaining equipment, and ensuring data accuracy. You will work closely with senior chemists and other internal teams to maintain high standards of quality, safety, and compliance. Whether you are starting your career or already have practical experience, this role provides an opportunity to deepen your technical skills in a dynamic laboratory environment. Conduct physical and chemical analysis of samples from serial production, using recommended methods and paying attention to the quality of results. Prepare samples for analytical measurements, including receiving from the client, registering in LIMS, and archiving. Perform analytical measurements according to recommended methods in designated analytical areas and input data into the central LIMS database. Evaluate and compare analysis results, assessing based on control limits. Conduct MSA tests. Use equipment in a proper and safe manner based on dedicated documentation. Ensure optimal operations of designated laboratory equipment by performing periodic maintenance plans and appropriate reviews. Supervise chemicals and reference materials for the designated analytical area: Use chemicals in a proper and safe manner based on dedicated documentation (SDS, Work Instructions). Dispose of waste safely. Maintain the laboratory workspace in cleanliness and order (e.g., according to 5S). Requirements: - Education: higher education (including bachelor's) - mandatory - others: Secondary technical or bachelor's education in chemistry or a related field, 1 year of laboratory work experience. Knowledge of ISO9001, ISO17025, and concepts such as measurement uncertainty and traceability. Basic knowledge of analytical equipment (e.g. PSD, ICP, BET, XRD, SEM, KF, titration) will be an additional advantage. Ability to work carefully and diligently.

job_title: Manager TTE & Process Engineering (Engineer - Mechanical Engineering)
full_description: We’re looking for a dynamic leader to oversee our Tooling & Test Equipment (TTE) and Process Engineering teams. In this role, you’ll ensure our shops are equipped with reliable tooling, robust technical processes, and the support and documentation needed to operate at their best. Responsibilities and Tasks including but are not limited to the following: - Organizes, supervises and leads Engineering teams to provide capable TTE, technical processes and support. - Leads Engineering teams to provide capable TTE, technical processes, support and documentation. - Leads employee relations through clear communication and coaching. - Plans, executes and monitors TTE/process projects to meet time, budget and quality targets. - Ensures compliance with regulations, safety and environmental requirements. - Defines and optimizes targets and KPIs. - Assists in incident/deviation analysis and recommendations. - Contributes to LHT’s iMRO network. - Assists Director of Engineering on major projects. - Ensures employee qualifications and compliance with company policies. Your profile: In this role, you will play a key part in leading our Engineering teams and ensuring the reliability and effectiveness of our tooling, processes, and technical support. Success in this position requires strong leadership skills, technical expertise, and a proactive approach to continuous improvement. - Minimum 5 years of professional experience - Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in mechanical or electrical engineering - Strong written and spoken Portuguese and English skills, German desirable - Professional experience in aircraft, engine, component engineering/maintenance, or material planning preferred - Strong computer skills (MS Office, SAP) - Good knowledge of logistics - High customer focus, service mindset - Excellent analytical, planning, flexibility, and decision-making skills - Ability to structure, schedule and plan complex work - Strong decision-making and sense of responsibility Please send your application in English. Candidates must have the right to live/work in Portugal. Applications will be evaluated based solely on the candidates' merit, without consideration of any other factors.

job_title: Engine Mechanic for Composite Parts (Engineer - Mechanical Engineering)
full_description: The mechanic in the composite division is responsible for the manual and technical repair of composite engine parts and accessories. They will be working with complex technical systems, ensuring high standards of safety and quality in every task. Responsibilities and Tasks including but are not limited to the following: - Inspection and repair of composite parts - Manual and technical repairs of composite materials (manual grinding, preparing surfaces, priming, painting using a roller or touch-up, heat treatment) - Apply manufacturer specifications and technical documentation - Structure, plan and schedule complex work and technical processes. - Collaborate with team members to solve technical challenges and streamline workflows. - Quality control and documentation of work completed using relevant software. Your Profile: We’re looking for a motivated Composite Mechanic with the following skills: - Completed technical vocational training (metalworking or composite processing profession) desirable, but experience in the composite sector is not required. Career changers welcome. - Very good knowledge of English and Portuguese, both written and spoken - Ability to structure, schedule and plan complex work processes and technical issues. - Very good computer skills (MS Office, SAP, etc.) Together with your application, please provide documentation (if available) as follows: - Foreign certificate/diploma with curriculum - AML (if comparable to EASA/FAA/TCCA license) - Confirmation letters from former employers - Part 147 or OEM certificate or known maintenance organization certificate with curriculum Please send your application in English. THE DESIRED COMPETENCY PROFILE FOR THE POSITION(S) INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: USE SCIENTIFIC METHOD, BOTH FOR SOLVING TECHNOLOGICAL PROBLEMS ACCORDING TO CURRENT KNOWLEDGE PARADIGMS AND FOR BUILDING A NEW PARADIGM; KNOW AND APPLY CURRENT PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE IN THE SOCIAL REALITY WHERE THEY WILL EXERCISE THEIR ACTIVITY; CREATE AND USE MODELS FOR DESIGNING AND ANALYZING SYSTEMS, PRODUCTS, AND PROCESSES; MASTER COMPUTATIONAL TECHNIQUES AND ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION; MASTER THE NATIVE LANGUAGE AND ENGLISH IN ORAL PRESENTATION, COMPREHENSION, AND WRITING; WORK IN TEAMS AND INDIVIDUALLY; DEVELOP LEADERSHIP CAPACITY AND ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT IN PROBLEM SOLVING FOCUSING ON THE ACTIVE SEARCH FOR SOLUTIONS; APPLY THE KNOWLEDGE IN PRACTICE AND IN A WORKSHOP CONTEXT; LAST BUT NOT LEAST, A LOVE FOR THE AREA, MOTIVATION, AND DISPOSITION FOR ACQUIRING NEW KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS AIMED AT PROFESSIONAL GROWTH, AS WELL AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE COMPANY, ARE VALUED. job_title: Process Expert (f/m/d) Lead to Cash for Service & Governance Units (Business Economist (University))
full_description: Transform the everyday. Join our team as a Lead to Cash Process Expert (m/f/d) and play a key role in driving automation, digitalization, and harmonization across Siemens' finance and controlling processes. As part of our team, you will have: - An attractive remuneration package - Appealing Siemens pension benefits and access to employee share plans - 30 days of paid vacation and a variety of flexible work schedules that allow time off for you and your family - 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard Since each of over 300,000 employees feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here (https://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs/benefits-what-we-offer.html). The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions. This will be your impact: - Process Design and Automation: As a process expert for the Lead-to-Cash process across SFS, SRE, and Service & Governance, you’ll analyze global and regional needs and ensure systems are aligned using harmonized templates for financial processes. - Business Requirements Evaluation: You’ll review business needs for order management, including customer communication, and design clear, efficient processes that meet both business and technical goals. - System Harmonization: You’ll align systems and templates with financial reporting rules and legal standards to ensure consistency and compliance. - Cross-Project Management: You’ll manage tasks that span multiple projects, including adapting guidelines and documenting changes to accounting instructions (AIFG). - Implementation and Development: You’ll lead process improvements from concept to go-live, creating solutions that work for both business and IT teams. You’ll also present current and future designs in your governance role. - Communication & Collaboration: - With Siemens corporate units (SFS, SRE, and Service & Governance) to align on future Lead-to-Cash process needs. - With Sherpa X project teams to ensure integrated and consistent solutions. - With contributors across the Sherpa X program. - With Siemens IT teams to support standard system delivery. This is how you'll win us over: - Education: Master’s degree in business studies or economics or alternatively comparable qualification has been reached - Experience & Skills: - Several years of professional experience, preferably in the field of finance related solutions, as well as experience with SAP S4 - Expertise in Lead-to-Cash processes - Good understanding of SAP S/4HANA and other Finance related solutions in general - You have 3-5 years of hands on experience and expertise in SAP SD - Expertise in other technical components relevant for the Lead-to-Cash Process within Sherpa X (SAP BTP, SAP DRC, EDI) is a plus - Knowledge of agile project methodology, experience in a global environment, operational business experience as well as intercultural experience is key - Affinity for IT and are willing to familiarize yourself with IT structures is helpful - Ways of working: Experience in working within virtual and global teams and you are a standout colleague with excellent communication and interpersonal skills - Languages: Business proficiency in English You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you! Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities (https://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs/life-at-siemens/inclusion.html). Protecting the environment, conserving our natural resources, fostering the health and performance of our people as well as safeguarding their working conditions are core to our social and business commitment at Siemens. About us. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, we’ll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future! www.siemens.com/careers (http://www.siemens.com/careers) – if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens. FAQ (https://www.siemens.com/global/en/company/jobs/faq.html) – if you need further information on the application process.

Apply today and join us in Lisbon!

As a Senior Tax Technology Expert (m/f/d) for the Digital Tax Eco-System, you will help shape the framework for digital transformation, especially in relation to the introduction of a global tax engine within the SAP S4 implementation for Siemens Group. What we offer you - An attractive remuneration package - Access to Siemens share plans - 30 days of paid vacation and a variety of flexible work schedules that allow time off for you and your family - 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard - Flexible training opportunities for both your professional and personal development that you can tailor to your interests Since each of over 300,000 team members feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here (https://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs/benefits-what-we-offer.html). The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions. You’ll make an impact - You will be part of the project team responsible for rolling out a global tax engine across several projects. - Collaboration with Tax Governance, Siemens IT, and external partners will be a key part of your daily work to ensure a forward-looking Siemens IT landscape supported by the right tools. - You will contribute to innovative digital advancements in Siemens’ tax function for VAT/GST by developing and implementing concepts in collaboration with your team, always considering cross-country requirements. - You will participate in projects and act as an interface between departments, including supporting the ongoing development of existing solutions. Your defining qualities - Education - Completed bachelor's studies in economics, law with a focus on taxation, or a comparable field. - Certified tax advisor or equivalent qualification - Experience & Skills - At least five years of professional experience in indirect taxation, with a focus on VAT (consulting, projects, compliance, processes, and digitalization) - In-depth knowledge of global indirect tax requirements for implementing tax determination solutions - Strong foundation in IT and solid understanding of SAP FI, SD, and MM processes - Extensive experience with automated tax determination solutions (e.g., Vertex) and solid knowledge of software for indirect tax compliance and reporting - Very good knowledge of tax authority structures and workflows in key Siemens countries and at the EU level - Project management experience, ideally with exposure to digitalization or digital business models - Familiarity with waterfall and agile methodologies - Ways of working: - Structured and analytical approach combined with a high level of initiative - Ability to manage complex projects and collaborate across functions and cultures - Languages - Your strong communication skills enable you to negotiate confidently in both German and English. You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you! Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer (https://www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/arbeiten-bei-siemens/inklusion.html) we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities. About us We are responsible for the global implementation of digitalization within the Siemens Global Business Services Tax department. In doing so, we draw on proven methods as well as new technologies. We are in constant, trusted exchange with our colleagues from Tax, Siemens IT, and external providers to ensure "best of breed" solutions for a future-oriented and technologically secure digitalization of our global tax function. We closely monitor regulatory changes and analyze their impact on the current and future landscape. In this context, we act in alignment with the Siemens IT strategy and its transformation in the coming years. www.siemens.de/careers (http://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs.html) – if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens. FAQ (http://www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/karrieren-entdecken.html) – if you need further information on the application process.

CONTEXT AND JOB DEFINITION: The leading independent French producer of carrots, from a long line of farmers, Planète Végétal is located in Gironde in the heart of the Landes de Gascogne Regional Natural Park (between Bordeaux and the Arcachon Basin). We also grow carrots in the Tagus Valley in Portugal. We are looking for a personality from the agricultural world, with significant experience in managing a farm, who enjoys working on the ground in an interface between agricultural production and management. You have good agronomic knowledge and a sensitivity to weather conditions to anticipate work in a highly seasonal activity structure. You are able to engage in various projects with loyalty and perseverance and to bring your role to life by involving yourself in the following tasks: 1 - Crop monitoring (70 to 100 ha) Monitoring all crops from planting to harvest Developing seeding schedules for carrots and planting schedules for leeks Diagnosing diseases and pests Developing intervention schedules Evaluating the effectiveness of interventions Managing traceability and applying standards with the ongoing maintenance of Globalgap certification Purchasing inputs and managing stocks 2 - Organization and Management (team of 3 people + seasonal workers) Managing the equipment (maintenance, repairs, operation of machinery, irrigation) Managing personnel (recruitment, administrative monitoring, management...) Managing downstream logistics with the transporter Managing suppliers 3 - Cost Management Developing and monitoring the budget Managing cash flow, payments to suppliers in connection with the Financial Management Monitoring, controlling, and validating invoices Optimizing costs Close links with the accountant 4 - Information Management Ensuring traceability in crop monitoring Ensuring traceability of interventions Performing daily/weekly reporting to management Being proactive in optimizing activities 5 - Actively participate in various production tasks and operations as needed to meet requirements and consider current demands. CANDIDATE PROFILE: With higher agricultural education (Bac+2 to +5) and a minimum of 5 to 10 years of experience in farm management, you share the values of hard work and respect for the land. You have a strong work ethic and possess excellent interpersonal skills. You are honest and demonstrate rigor. You are organized and have analytical and synthesis skills. You are proficient in office tools and familiar with new agricultural technologies (GPS, sensors, actuators, etc.). You speak operational Portuguese. Position based in SALVATERRA DE MAGOS in PORTUGAL.
